<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_02" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_02_z010" data-origname="metamark">2.</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>come aroun' in behint 'em<tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_02_z024" data-origname="add">"</tei-add>.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>To his attentive audience, he drew a loud and elabor-
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ate plan of a very <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_02_z025" data-origname="del">successful</tei-del> brilliant campaign.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>When he had finished, the blue-clothed men scattered
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>into small, arguing groups in the little lane between
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the rows of squat, brown huts. Here and th<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_02_z029" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_02_z029" data-origname="del">r</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_02_z029" data-origname="add">e</tei-add></tei-subst>re was
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a steel-glitter. Smoke drifted lazily from bar-
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>rel-chimneys.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"It's a lie—that's all it is. A thunderin' lie,"
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>said young Wilson. His smooth face was flushed
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and his hands were thrust sulkily into his trouser's
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pockets. He took the matter as a personal affront.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"I don't believe th' derned ol' army's ever goin' t' move.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>We're sot. I've got ready t' move eight times in th' last
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>two weeks an' we aint moved yit."
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Conklin felt called upon to defend the truth of
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a rumor he had introduced. He and <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_02_z031" data-origname="del">f</tei-del> young Wilson
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>came near to fighting over it.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Simpson, a corporal, began to swear. He had
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>just put a costly board-floor in his house, he said.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He had refrained from adding extensively to the
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>comfort of his environment during the spring be-
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cause he had felt that the army might <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_02_z032" data-origname="del">move</tei-del>
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>start on the march at any moment. Lately,
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>however, he had been impressed that they were in
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a sort of eternal camp. So, he and his two mates
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had put in a board-floor! And now the
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>army was going to move<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_02_z034" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_02_z034" data-origname="del">.</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_02_z034" data-origname="add">!</tei-add></tei-subst>!
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Many of the men engaged in a spirited</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Simpson, a corporal, began to swear. He had
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>just put a costly board-floor in his house, he said.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He had refrained from adding extensively to the
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>comfort of his environment during the spring be-
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cause he had felt that the army might <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_02_z032" data-origname="del">move</tei-del>
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>start on the march at any moment. Lately,
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>however, he had been impressed that they were in
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a sort of eternal camp. So, he and his two mates
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had put in a board-floor! And now the
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>army was going to move<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_02_z034" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_02_z034" data-origname="del">.</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_02_z034" data-origname="add">!</tei-add></tei-subst>!
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Many of the men engaged in a spirited</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_02" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_02_z010" data-origname="metamark">2.</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>come aroun' in behint 'em<tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_02_z024" data-origname="add">"</tei-add>.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>To his attentive audience, he drew a loud and elabor-
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ate plan of a very <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_02_z025" data-origname="del">successful</tei-del> brilliant campaign.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>When he had finished, the blue-clothed men scattered
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>into small, arguing groups in the little lane between
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the rows of squat, brown huts. Here and th<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_02_z029" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_02_z029" data-origname="del">r</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_02_z029" data-origname="add">e</tei-add></tei-subst>re was
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a steel-glitter. Smoke drifted lazily from bar-
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>rel-chimneys.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"It's a lie—that's all it is. A thunderin' lie,"
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>said young Wilson. His smooth face was flushed
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and his hands were thrust sulkily into his trouser's
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pockets. He took the matter as a personal affront.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"I don't believe th' derned ol' army's ever goin' t' move.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>We're sot. I've got ready t' move eight times in th' last
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>two weeks an' we aint moved yit."
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Conklin felt called upon to defend the truth of
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a rumor he had introduced. He and <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_02_z031" data-origname="del">f</tei-del> young Wilson
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>came near to fighting over it.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Simpson, a corporal, began to swear. He had
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>just put a costly board-floor in his house, he said.

<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>start on the march at any moment. Lately,
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>however, he had been impressed that they were in
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a sort of eternal camp. So, he and his two mates
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had put in a board-floor! And now the
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>army was going to move<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_02_z034" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_02_z034" data-origname="del">.</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_02_z034" data-origname="add">!</tei-add></tei-subst>!
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Many of the men engaged in a spirited</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>When he had finished, the blue-clothed men scattered
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>into small, arguing groups in the little lane between
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the rows of squat, brown huts. Here and th<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_02_z029" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_02_z029" data-origname="del">r</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_02_z029" data-origname="add">e</tei-add></tei-subst>re was
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a steel-glitter. Smoke drifted lazily from bar-
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>rel-chimneys.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"It's a lie—that's all it is. A thunderin' lie,"

<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and his hands were thrust sulkily into his trouser's
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pockets. He took the matter as a personal affront.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"I don't believe th' derned ol' army's ever goin' t' move.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>We're sot. I've got ready t' move eight times in th' last
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>two weeks an' we aint moved yit."
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Conklin felt called upon to defend the truth of
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a rumor he had introduced. He and <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_02_z031" data-origname="del">f</tei-del> young Wilson
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>came near to fighting over it.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Simpson, a corporal, began to swear. He had
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>just put a costly board-floor in his house, he said.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He had refrained from adding extensively to the
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>comfort of his environment during the spring be-
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cause he had felt that the army might <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_02_z032" data-origname="del">move</tei-del>

<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>however, he had been impressed that they were in
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a sort of eternal camp. So, he and his two mates
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had put in a board-floor! And now the
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>army was going to move<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_02_z034" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_02_z034" data-origname="del">.</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_02_z034" data-origname="add">!</tei-add></tei-subst>!
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Many of the men engaged in a spirited</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_04" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_04_z014" data-origname="metamark">4</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>other end. A picture from an illustrated weekly
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>was upon the log wall and three rifles were
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>paral<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_04_z007" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z007" data-origname="del">l</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z007" data-origname="add">e</tei-add></tei-subst><tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_04_z015" data-origname="subst">e<tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z015" data-origname="del">l</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z015" data-origname="add">l</tei-add></tei-subst>led on pegs. Some tin dishes lay on a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>small pile of fire-wood. Equipments were hung
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>on handy projections. The smoke from the fire
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>at times neglected the clay-chimney and wreathed
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>into the room. A small window shot an ob-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>lique square of light upon the cluttered floor.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>So, they were at last going to fight. On
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the morrow, perhaps, there would be a battle and
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he would be in it.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He could not convince himself of it. It
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>was too strange. He could not believe with assurance
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that he was at last to mingle in one of those great
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>affairs of the earth.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He had dreamed of battles all his life--
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of vague, bloody conflicts that had thrilled
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>him with their sweep and fire. In visions, he
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had seen himself in many struggles. But, awake,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z008" data-origname="add">had</tei-add> regarded battles as crimson blotches on
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the pages of the past. He had put them, as
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>things of <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z010" data-origname="del">history</tei-del><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z011" data-origname="del">,</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z009" data-origname="add">the bygone,</tei-add> with his thought-images of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>heavy golden crowns and high dreary castles<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_04_z012" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z012" data-origname="del">,</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z012" data-origname="add">.</tei-add></tei-subst>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>There was a portion of the world's history which
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he had regarded as the time of war, but, that,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he had thought, had gone over the horizon
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and disappeared forever. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>From his home, his youthful eyes had looked
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>at the war in his own country with distrust.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="5" unit="leaf" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_04" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_04_z014" data-origname="metamark">4</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>other end.   <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He could not convince himself of it. It

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>heavy golden crowns and high dreary castles<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_04_z012" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z012" data-origname="del">,</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z012" data-origname="add">.</tei-add></tei-subst>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>at the war in his own country with distrust.

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_04" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_04_z014" data-origname="metamark">4</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>other end. A picture from an illustrated weekly
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>was upon the log wall and three rifles were
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>paral<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_04_z007" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z007" data-origname="del">l</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z007" data-origname="add">e</tei-add></tei-subst><tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_04_z015" data-origname="subst">e<tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z015" data-origname="del">l</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z015" data-origname="add">l</tei-add></tei-subst>led on pegs. Some tin dishes lay on a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>small pile of fire-wood. Equipments were hung
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>on handy projections. The smoke from the fire
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>at times neglected the clay-chimney and wreathed
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>into the room. A small window shot an ob-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>lique square of light upon the cluttered floor.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>So, they were at last going to fight. On
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the morrow, perhaps, there would be a battle and
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he would be in it.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He could not convince himself of it. It
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>was too strange. He could not believe with assurance
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that he was at last to mingle in one of those great
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>affairs of the earth.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He had dreamed of battles all his life--
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of vague, bloody conflicts that had thrilled
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>him with their sweep and fire. In visions, he
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had seen himself in many struggles. But, awake,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z008" data-origname="add">had</tei-add> regarded battles as crimson blotches on
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the pages of the past. He had put them, as
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>things of <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z010" data-origname="del">history</tei-del><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z011" data-origname="del">,</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z009" data-origname="add">the bygone,</tei-add> with his thought-images of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>heavy golden crowns and high dreary castles<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_04_z012" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z012" data-origname="del">,</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z012" data-origname="add">.</tei-add></tei-subst>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>There was a portion of the world's history which
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he had regarded as the time of war, but, that,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he had thought, had gone over the horizon
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and disappeared forever. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>From his home, his youthful eyes had looked
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>at the war in his own country with distrust.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="5" unit="leaf" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

Some tin dishes lay on a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>small pile of fire-wood. Equipments were hung
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>on handy projections. The smoke from the fire
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>at times neglected the clay-chimney and wreathed
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>into the room. A small window shot an ob-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>lique square of light upon the cluttered floor.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>So, they were at last going to fight. On
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the morrow, perhaps, there would be a battle and
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he would be in it.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He could not convince himself of it. It
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>was too strange. He could not believe with assurance
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that he was at last to mingle in one of those great
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>affairs of the earth.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He had dreamed of battles all his life--
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of vague, bloody conflicts that had thrilled
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>him with their sweep and fire. In visions, he
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had seen himself in many struggles. But, awake,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z008" data-origname="add">had</tei-add> regarded battles as crimson blotches on
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the pages of the past. He had put them, as
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>things of <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z010" data-origname="del">history</tei-del><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z011" data-origname="del">,</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z009" data-origname="add">the bygone,</tei-add> with his thought-images of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>heavy golden crowns and high dreary castles<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_04_z012" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z012" data-origname="del">,</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z012" data-origname="add">.</tei-add></tei-subst>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>There was a portion of the world's history which
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he had regarded as the time of war, but, that,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he had thought, had gone over the horizon
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and disappeared forever. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>From his home, his youthful eyes had looked
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>at the war in his own country with distrust.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="5" unit="leaf" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_04" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_04_z014" data-origname="metamark">4</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>other end. A picture from an illustrated weekly
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>was upon the log wall and three rifles were
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>paral<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_04_z007" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z007" data-origname="del">l</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z007" data-origname="add">e</tei-add></tei-subst><tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_04_z015" data-origname="subst">e<tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z015" data-origname="del">l</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z015" data-origname="add">l</tei-add></tei-subst>led on pegs. Some tin dishes lay on a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>small pile of fire-wood. Equipments were hung
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>on handy projections. The smoke from the fire
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>at times neglected the clay-chimney and wreathed
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>into the room. A small window shot an ob-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>lique square of light upon the cluttered floor.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>So, they were at last going to fight. On
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the morrow, perhaps, there would be a battle and
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he would be in it.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He could not convince himself of it. It
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>was too strange. He could not believe with assurance
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that he was at last to mingle in one of those great
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>affairs of the earth.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He had dreamed of battles all his life--
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of vague, bloody conflicts that had thrilled
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>him with their sweep and fire. In visions, he
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had seen himself in many struggles. But, awake,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z008" data-origname="add">had</tei-add> regarded battles as crimson blotches on
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the pages of the past. He had put them, as
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>things of <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z010" data-origname="del">history</tei-del><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z011" data-origname="del">,</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z009" data-origname="add">the bygone,</tei-add> with his thought-images of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>heavy golden crowns and high dreary castles<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_04_z012" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z012" data-origname="del">,</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_04_z012" data-origname="add">.</tei-add></tei-subst>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>There was a portion of the world's history which
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he had regarded as the time of war, but, that,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he had thought, had gone over the horizon
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and disappeared forever. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>From his home, his youthful eyes had looked
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>at the war in his own country with distrust.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="5" unit="leaf" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_06" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_07" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_07_z008" data-origname="metamark">7</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>anybody in the army. Whenever, they git holes in
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>'em, I want yeh t' send 'em right-away back
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t' me, so's <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z006" data-origname="del">thet</tei-del> I kin darn 'em. An' allus be
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>keerful, Henry, an' choose yer comp'ny. There's
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>lots of bad men in th' army. Th' army makes
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>'em wild an' they like nothin' better than th'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>job of leadin' off a young fellah like you, as
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>aint never been away from home much an'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>has allus had a mother; an' learnin' him t'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>drink an' swear. I don't want yeh t' ever do
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>anything, Henry, that yeh would be ashamed
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t' let me know about an' if yeh keep right
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t' that, I guess yeh'll come out pretty straight.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Young fellers in th' army git mighty keer-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>less in <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z004" data-origname="del">th</tei-del><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z005" data-origname="del">'army</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z003" data-origname="add">their ways,</tei-add> bein' away from home,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>an' I'm afeard for yeh 'bout that Henry.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Yeh mus' remember yer father, chil', an'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>remember he never drunk a drop a' lick
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>er in his life nor <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z002" data-origname="add">never</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z001" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark> swore a cross oath.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>I don't know what else t' tell yeh, Henry,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>exceptin' that yeh mustn't never do no shirk-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in', Henry, on my account. If so be a time
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>comes when yeh have t' be kilt or do a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>mean thing, why, Henry, don't think of any-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>thin' excepts what's right, b'cause there's
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>many a woman has t' bear up 'ginst sech
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>things these times. Don't ferget t' send yer
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>socks t' me th' minute they git holes in 'em,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>an' here's a little bible I want yeh t' take
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_07" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_07_z008" data-origname="metamark">7</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>anybody in the army. Whenever, they git holes in
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>'em, I want yeh t' send 'em right-away back
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t' me, so's <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z006" data-origname="del">thet</tei-del> I kin darn 'em. An' allus be
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>keerful, Henry, an' choose yer comp'ny. There's
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>lots of bad men in th' army. Th' army makes
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>'em wild an' they like nothin' better than th'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>job of leadin' off a young fellah like you, as
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>aint never been away from home much an'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>has allus had a mother; an' learnin' him t'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>drink an' swear. I don't want yeh t' ever do
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>anything, Henry, that yeh would be ashamed
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t' let me know about an' if yeh keep right
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t' that, I guess yeh'll come out pretty straight.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Young fellers in th' army git mighty keer-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>less in <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z004" data-origname="del">th</tei-del><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z005" data-origname="del">'army</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z003" data-origname="add">their ways,</tei-add> bein' away from home,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>an' I'm afeard for yeh 'bout that Henry.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Yeh mus' remember yer father, chil', an'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>remember he never drunk a drop a' lick
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>er in his life nor <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z002" data-origname="add">never</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z001" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark> swore a cross oath.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>I don't know what else t' tell yeh, Henry,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>exceptin' that yeh mustn't never do no shirk-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in', Henry, on my account. If so be a time
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>comes when yeh have t' be kilt or do a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>mean thing, why, Henry, don't think of any-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>thin' excepts what's right, b'cause there's
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>many a woman has t' bear up 'ginst sech
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>things these times. Don't ferget t' send yer
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>socks t' me th' minute they git holes in 'em,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>an' here's a little bible I want yeh t' take
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_07" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_07_z008" data-origname="metamark">7</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>anybody in the army.   <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>'em, I want yeh t' send 'em right-away back
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t' me, so's <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z006" data-origname="del">thet</tei-del> I kin darn 'em. An' allus be
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>keerful, Henry, an' choose yer comp'ny. There's
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>lots of bad men in th' army. Th' army makes
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>'em wild an' they like nothin' better than th'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>job of leadin' off a young fellah like you, as
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>aint never been away from home much an'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>has allus had a mother; an' learnin' him t'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>drink an' swear. I don't want yeh t' ever do
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>anything, Henry, that yeh would be ashamed
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t' let me know about an' if yeh keep right
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t' that, I guess yeh'll come out pretty straight.

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in', Henry, on my account. If so be a time
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>comes when yeh have t' be kilt or do a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>mean thing, why, Henry, don't think of any-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>thin' excepts what's right, b'cause there's
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>many a woman has t' bear up 'ginst sech
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>things these times. Don't ferget t' send yer
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>socks t' me th' minute they git holes in 'em,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>an' here's a little bible I want yeh t' take
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t' me, so's <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z006" data-origname="del">thet</tei-del> I kin darn 'em. An' allus be
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>keerful, Henry, an' choose yer comp'ny. There's
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>lots of bad men in th' army. Th' army makes
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>'em wild an' they like nothin' better than th'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>job of leadin' off a young fellah like you, as
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>aint never been away from home much an'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>has allus had a mother; an' learnin' him t'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>drink an' swear. I don't want yeh t' ever do
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>anything, Henry, that yeh would be ashamed
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t' let me know about an' if yeh keep right
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t' that, I guess yeh'll come out pretty straight.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Young fellers in th' army git mighty keer-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>less in <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z004" data-origname="del">th</tei-del><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z005" data-origname="del">'army</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z003" data-origname="add">their ways,</tei-add> bein' away from home,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>an' I'm afeard for yeh 'bout that Henry.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Yeh mus' remember yer father, chil', an'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>remember he never drunk a drop a' lick
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>er in his life nor <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z002" data-origname="add">never</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z001" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark> swore a cross oath.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>I don't know what else t' tell yeh, Henry,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>exceptin' that yeh mustn't never do no shirk-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in', Henry, on my account. If so be a time
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>comes when yeh have t' be kilt or do a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>mean thing, why, Henry, don't think of any-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>thin' excepts what's right, b'cause there's
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>many a woman has t' bear up 'ginst sech
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>things these times. Don't ferget t' send yer
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>socks t' me th' minute they git holes in 'em,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>an' here's a little bible I want yeh t' take
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_07" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_07_z008" data-origname="metamark">7</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>anybody in the army. Whenever, they git holes in
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>'em, I want yeh t' send 'em right-away back
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t' me, so's <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z006" data-origname="del">thet</tei-del> I kin darn 'em. An' allus be
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>keerful, Henry, an' choose yer comp'ny. There's

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>'em wild an' they like nothin' better than th'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>job of leadin' off a young fellah like you, as
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>aint never been away from home much an'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>has allus had a mother; an' learnin' him t'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>drink an' swear. I don't want yeh t' ever do
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>anything, Henry, that yeh would be ashamed
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t' let me know about an' if yeh keep right
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t' that, I guess yeh'll come out pretty straight.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Young fellers in th' army git mighty keer-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>less in <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z004" data-origname="del">th</tei-del><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z005" data-origname="del">'army</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z003" data-origname="add">their ways,</tei-add> bein' away from home,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>an' I'm afeard for yeh 'bout that Henry.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Yeh mus' remember yer father, chil', an'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>remember he never drunk a drop a' lick
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>er in his life nor <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z002" data-origname="add">never</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_07_z001" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark> swore a cross oath.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>I don't know what else t' tell yeh, Henry,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>exceptin' that yeh mustn't never do no shirk-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in', Henry, on my account. If so be a time
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>comes when yeh have t' be kilt or do a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>mean thing, why, Henry, don't think of any-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>thin' excepts what's right, b'cause there's
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>many a woman has t' bear up 'ginst sech
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>things these times. Don't ferget t' send yer
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>socks t' me th' minute they git holes in 'em,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>an' here's a little bible I want yeh t' take
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_08" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_08_z010" data-origname="metamark">8</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>along with yeh, Henry. I don't expect yeh'll
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>be a-settin' readin' <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z008" data-origname="add">it</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z009" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark> all day long, child,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ner nothin' like that. Many times<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z011" data-origname="del">,</tei-del> yeh'll
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>fergit yeh got it, I don't doubt. But there's
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>many times, Henry, yeh'll be wantin' advice,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Henry, an' all like that, an' there'll be
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>nobody 'round, perhaps, t' show yeh. Then
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>if yeh take it out, yeh'Il find wisdom t' set
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>yeh straight with little searchin', Henry.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Don't fergit about th' socks, an' I've put
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>some blackberry jam with yer things
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>'cause I know yeh like it above all.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_08_z006" data-origname="del">things.</tei-del> Good-bye, Henry, an' be a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>good boy."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He had born this speech with impatience.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It was not quite what he <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#unattributed" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z004" data-origname="add">had</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z005" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark> expected and it
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had made him feel sheepish. He had felt
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>glad that no one of his friends had been
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>there to listen to it.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>From his home, he had gone to the sem-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>inary to bid adieu to many old schoolmates.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>There, a certain light-haired girl <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_08_z003" data-origname="del">ma</tei-del> had made
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>vivacious efforts to poke fun at his martial spirit.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But there was another girl who, he <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z002" data-origname="del">had</tei-del> thought,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had become <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_08_z001" data-origname="del">ve</tei-del> demure and sad at sight of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his blue and brass. As he had walked down the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>aisle between the rows of oaks on the lawn, he
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had discovered her watching his departure
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>from a window. As he had turned and
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_08" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_08_z010" data-origname="metamark">8</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>along with yeh, Henry.   <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>nobody 'round, perhaps, t' show yeh. Then
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>if yeh take it out, yeh'Il find wisdom t' set
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>yeh straight with little searchin', Henry.

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>some blackberry jam with yer things
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>'cause I know yeh like it above all.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_08_z006" data-origname="del">things.</tei-del> Good-bye, Henry, an' be a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>good boy."

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It was not quite what he <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#unattributed" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z004" data-origname="add">had</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z005" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark> expected and it
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had made him feel sheepish. He had felt
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>glad that no one of his friends had been
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>there to listen to it.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>From his home, he had gone to the sem-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>inary to bid adieu to many old schoolmates.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>There, a certain light-haired girl <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_08_z003" data-origname="del">ma</tei-del> had made
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>vivacious efforts to poke fun at his martial spirit.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But there was another girl who, he <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z002" data-origname="del">had</tei-del> thought,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had become <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_08_z001" data-origname="del">ve</tei-del> demure and sad at sight of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his blue and brass. As he had walked down the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>aisle between the rows of oaks on the lawn, he
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had discovered her watching his departure
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>from a window. As he had turned and
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his blue and brass. As he had walked down the

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had discovered her watching his departure

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_08" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_08_z010" data-origname="metamark">8</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>along with yeh, Henry. I don't expect yeh'll
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>be a-settin' readin' <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z008" data-origname="add">it</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z009" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark> all day long, child,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ner nothin' like that. Many times<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z011" data-origname="del">,</tei-del> yeh'll
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>fergit yeh got it, I don't doubt. But there's
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>many times, Henry, yeh'll be wantin' advice,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Henry, an' all like that, an' there'll be
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>nobody 'round, perhaps, t' show yeh. Then
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>if yeh take it out, yeh'Il find wisdom t' set
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>yeh straight with little searchin', Henry.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Don't fergit about th' socks, an' I've put
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>some blackberry jam with yer things
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>'cause I know yeh like it above all.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_08_z006" data-origname="del">things.</tei-del> Good-bye, Henry, an' be a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>good boy."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He had born this speech with impatience.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It was not quite what he <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#unattributed" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z004" data-origname="add">had</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z005" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark> expected and it
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had made him feel sheepish. He had felt
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>glad that no one of his friends had been
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>there to listen to it.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>From his home, he had gone to the sem-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>inary to bid adieu to many old schoolmates.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>There, a certain light-haired girl <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_08_z003" data-origname="del">ma</tei-del> had made
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>vivacious efforts to poke fun at his martial spirit.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But there was another girl who, he <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z002" data-origname="del">had</tei-del> thought,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had become <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_08_z001" data-origname="del">ve</tei-del> demure and sad at sight of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his blue and brass. As he had walked down the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>aisle between the rows of oaks on the lawn, he
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had discovered her watching his departure
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>from a window. As he had turned and

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>nobody 'round, perhaps, t' show yeh. Then
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>if yeh take it out, yeh'Il find wisdom t' set
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>yeh straight with little searchin', Henry.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Don't fergit about th' socks, an' I've put
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>some blackberry jam with yer things
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>'cause I know yeh like it above all.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_08_z006" data-origname="del">things.</tei-del> Good-bye, Henry, an' be a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>good boy."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He had born this speech with impatience.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It was not quite what he <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#unattributed" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z004" data-origname="add">had</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z005" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark> expected and it
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had made him feel sheepish. He had felt
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>glad that no one of his friends had been
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>there to listen to it.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>From his home, he had gone to the sem-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>inary to bid adieu to many old schoolmates.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>There, a certain light-haired girl <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_08_z003" data-origname="del">ma</tei-del> had made
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>vivacious efforts to poke fun at his martial spirit.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But there was another girl who, he <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z002" data-origname="del">had</tei-del> thought,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had become <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_08_z001" data-origname="del">ve</tei-del> demure and sad at sight of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his blue and brass. As he had walked down the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>aisle between the rows of oaks on the lawn, he
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had discovered her watching his departure
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>from a window. As he had turned and
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_08" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_08_z010" data-origname="metamark">8</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>along with yeh, Henry. I don't expect yeh'll
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>be a-settin' readin' <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z008" data-origname="add">it</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z009" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark> all day long, child,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ner nothin' like that. Many times<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z011" data-origname="del">,</tei-del> yeh'll
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>fergit yeh got it, I don't doubt. But there's
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>many times, Henry, yeh'll be wantin' advice,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Henry, an' all like that, an' there'll be
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>nobody 'round, perhaps, t' show yeh. Then
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>if yeh take it out, yeh'Il find wisdom t' set
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>yeh straight with little searchin', Henry.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Don't fergit about th' socks, an' I've put
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>some blackberry jam with yer things
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>'cause I know yeh like it above all.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_08_z006" data-origname="del">things.</tei-del> Good-bye, Henry, an' be a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>good boy."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He had born this speech with impatience.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It was not quite what he <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#unattributed" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z004" data-origname="add">had</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z005" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark> expected and it
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had made him feel sheepish. He had felt
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>glad that no one of his friends had been
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>there to listen to it.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>From his home, he had gone to the sem-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>inary to bid adieu to many old schoolmates.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>There, a certain light-haired girl <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_08_z003" data-origname="del">ma</tei-del> had made
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>vivacious efforts to poke fun at his martial spirit.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But there was another girl who, he <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z002" data-origname="del">had</tei-del> thought,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had become <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_08_z001" data-origname="del">ve</tei-del> demure and sad at sight of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his blue and brass. As he had walked down the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>aisle between the rows of oaks on the lawn, he
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had discovered her watching his departure
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>from a window. As he had turned and
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>From his home, he had gone to the sem-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>inary to bid adieu to many old schoolmates.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>There, a certain light-haired girl <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_08_z003" data-origname="del">ma</tei-del> had made
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>vivacious efforts to poke fun at his martial spirit.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But there was another girl who, he <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z002" data-origname="del">had</tei-del> thought,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had become <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_08_z001" data-origname="del">ve</tei-del> demure and sad at sight of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his blue and brass. As he had walked down the

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_08" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_08_z010" data-origname="metamark">8</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>along with yeh, Henry. I don't expect yeh'll
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>be a-settin' readin' <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z008" data-origname="add">it</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z009" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark> all day long, child,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ner nothin' like that. Many times<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z011" data-origname="del">,</tei-del> yeh'll
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>fergit yeh got it, I don't doubt. But there's
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>many times, Henry, yeh'll be wantin' advice,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Henry, an' all like that, an' there'll be
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>nobody 'round, perhaps, t' show yeh. Then
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>if yeh take it out, yeh'Il find wisdom t' set
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>yeh straight with little searchin', Henry.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Don't fergit about th' socks, an' I've put
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>some blackberry jam with yer things
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>'cause I know yeh like it above all.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_08_z006" data-origname="del">things.</tei-del> Good-bye, Henry, an' be a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>good boy."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He had born this speech with impatience.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It was not quite what he <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#unattributed" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z004" data-origname="add">had</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z005" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark> expected and it
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had made him feel sheepish. He had felt

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>From his home, he had gone to the sem-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>inary to bid adieu to many old schoolmates.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>There, a certain light-haired girl <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_08_z003" data-origname="del">ma</tei-del> had made
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>vivacious efforts to poke fun at his martial spirit.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But there was another girl who, he <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_08_z002" data-origname="del">had</tei-del> thought,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had become <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_08_z001" data-origname="del">ve</tei-del> demure and sad at sight of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his blue and brass. As he had walked down the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>aisle between the rows of oaks on the lawn, he
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had discovered her watching his departure
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>from a window. As he had turned and
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_10" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_10_z008" data-origname="metamark">10</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The only foes he had seen were the pickets on the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>river bank. They were a sun-tanned, philosophical
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>lot who sometimes shot thoughtfully at the oppos-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ite pickets but usually seemed sorry for it af-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>terwards. Fleming on guard duty one night had
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>talked across the river w:ith one. He was a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>slightly ragged man with a fund of sublime
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>assurance. Fleming liked him personally.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Various veterans had told him tales. Some
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>talked of grey, be-whiskered hordes who were
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>advancing, <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_10_z006" data-origname="del">chewing tobacco</tei-del> cursing relentlessly
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and chewing tobacco with unspeakable valor;
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tremendous bodies of fierce soldiery who were
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>sweeping along like the Huns. Others spoke
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of tattered and eternally hungry men who fired
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>despondent rifles. From their stories, <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_10_z004" data-origname="del">one</tei-del> <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_10_z003" data-origname="del">could</tei-del> <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_10_z005" data-origname="add">Fleming</tei-add>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>imagine<tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_10_z014" data-origname="add">d</tei-add> the red bones sticking out through <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_10_z002" data-origname="del">the</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>slits in the faded uniforms. Still, he could not
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>put <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_10_z001" data-origname="del">faith</tei-del> a whole faith in tales, for re-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cruits were the veteran's prey. They talked much
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of smoke, fire and blood but he could not
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tell how much might be lies.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>However, he percieved that it did not greatly
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>matter what kind of soldiers he was going to
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>fight. There was a more serious problem. He
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>lay in his bunk debating the question. He
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tried to solve it mathematically. He was en-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>deavoring to decide wether he would run
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>from a fight or not.
