<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_10" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_10_z008" data-origname="metamark">10</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The only foes he had seen were the pickets on the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>river bank. They were a sun-tanned, philosophical
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>lot who sometimes shot thoughtfully at the oppos-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ite pickets but usually seemed sorry for it af-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>terwards. Fleming on guard duty one night had
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>talked across the river w:ith one. He was a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>slightly ragged man with a fund of sublime
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>assurance. Fleming liked him personally.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Various veterans had told him tales. Some
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>talked of grey, be-whiskered hordes who were
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>advancing, <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_10_z006" data-origname="del">chewing tobacco</tei-del> cursing relentlessly
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and chewing tobacco with unspeakable valor;
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tremendous bodies of fierce soldiery who were
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>sweeping along like the Huns. Others spoke
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of tattered and eternally hungry men who fired
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>despondent rifles. From their stories, <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_10_z004" data-origname="del">one</tei-del> <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_10_z003" data-origname="del">could</tei-del> <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_10_z005" data-origname="add">Fleming</tei-add>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>imagine<tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_10_z014" data-origname="add">d</tei-add> the red bones sticking out through <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_10_z002" data-origname="del">the</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>slits in the faded uniforms. Still, he could not
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>put <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_10_z001" data-origname="del">faith</tei-del> a whole faith in tales, for re-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cruits were the veteran's prey. They talked much
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of smoke, fire and blood but he could not
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tell how much might be lies.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>However, he percieved that it did not greatly
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>matter what kind of soldiers he was going to
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>fight. There was a more serious problem. He
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>lay in his bunk debating the question. He
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tried to solve it mathematically. He was en-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>deavoring to decide wether he would run
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>from a fight or not.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It had suddenly come to his mind that
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>perhaps in a battle he might run. He was
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>imagine<tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_10_z014" data-origname="add">d</tei-add> the red bones sticking out through <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_10_z002" data-origname="del">the</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>slits in the faded uniforms. Still, he could not
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>put <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_10_z001" data-origname="del">faith</tei-del> a whole faith in tales, for re-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cruits were the veteran's prey. They talked much
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of smoke, fire and blood but he could not
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tell how much might be lies.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>However, he percieved that it did not greatly
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>matter what kind of soldiers he was going to
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>fight. There was a more serious problem. He
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>lay in his bunk debating the question. He
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tried to solve it mathematically. He was en-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>deavoring to decide wether he would run
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>from a fight or not.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It had suddenly come to his mind that
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>perhaps in a battle he might run. He was
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_10" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_10_z008" data-origname="metamark">10</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The only foes he had seen were the pickets on the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>river bank. They were a sun-tanned, philosophical
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>lot who sometimes shot thoughtfully at the oppos-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ite pickets but usually seemed sorry for it af-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>terwards. Fleming on guard duty one night had
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>talked across the river w:ith one. He was a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>slightly ragged man with a fund of sublime
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>assurance. Fleming liked him personally.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Various veterans had told him tales. Some
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>talked of grey, be-whiskered hordes who were
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>advancing, <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_10_z006" data-origname="del">chewing tobacco</tei-del> cursing relentlessly
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and chewing tobacco with unspeakable valor;
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tremendous bodies of fierce soldiery who were
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>sweeping along like the Huns. Others spoke
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of tattered and eternally hungry men who fired
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>despondent rifles.   <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of smoke, fire and blood but he could not

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>matter what kind of soldiers he was going to
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>fight. There was a more serious problem. He
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>lay in his bunk debating the question. He
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tried to solve it mathematically. He was en-

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It had suddenly come to his mind that
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>perhaps in a battle he might run. He was
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>lot who sometimes shot thoughtfully at the oppos-

From their stories, <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_10_z004" data-origname="del">one</tei-del> <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_10_z003" data-origname="del">could</tei-del> <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_10_z005" data-origname="add">Fleming</tei-add>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>imagine<tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_10_z014" data-origname="add">d</tei-add> the red bones sticking out through <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_10_z002" data-origname="del">the</tei-del>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_11" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_11_z001" data-origname="metamark">11</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>forced to admit that as far as war was con-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cerned he knew nothing of himself. Before <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_11_z002" data-origname="add">this,</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_11_z003" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he had never been obliged to grapple too seriously
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>with the question. He had taken certain
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>things for granted, even as in thoughts about
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his life, he had never <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_11_z005" data-origname="add">had</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_11_z006" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark> doubts of the ultimate
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>success of it and had bothered little about
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>means and roads.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But he was now suddenly confronted. As
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his imagination went forward to a fight, he
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>saw hideous possibilities. He contemplated the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>lurking menaces of the future and failed in
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>an effort to see himself standing stoutly
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in the midst of them. He recalled his <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_11_z007" data-origname="del">sha</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>visions of broken-bladed glory but in the sha-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>dow of the impending tumult, he suspected
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>them<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_11_z008" data-origname="del">.</tei-del> to be impossible<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_11_z009" data-origname="del">impossible</tei-del> pictures.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He sprang from his bunk and began to
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pace nervously up and down the floor. "Good
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Gawd, what's the matter with me," he cried to
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>himself.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He felt that his laws of life were
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>useless. Whatever he had learned of him-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>self was now of no consequence. He was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_11_z010" data-origname="add">an</tei-add> unknown quantity. He would again be ob-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>liged to experiment, as he had in early youth,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and get upon his guard, else those qualities
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of which he knew nothing might everlastingly
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>disgrace him. "Good Gawd," he repeated.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_11_z011" data-origname="add">in dismay.</tei-add>
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_11" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_11_z001" data-origname="metamark">11</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>forced to admit that as far as war was con-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cerned he knew nothing of himself. Before <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_11_z002" data-origname="add">this,</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_11_z003" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he had never been obliged to grapple too seriously
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>with the question. He had taken certain
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>things for granted, even as in thoughts about
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his life, he had never <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_11_z005" data-origname="add">had</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_11_z006" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark> doubts of the ultimate
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>success of it and had bothered little about
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>means and roads.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But he was now suddenly confronted. As
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his imagination went forward to a fight, he
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>saw hideous possibilities. He contemplated the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>lurking menaces of the future and failed in
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>an effort to see himself standing stoutly
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in the midst of them. He recalled his <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_11_z007" data-origname="del">sha</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>visions of broken-bladed glory but in the sha-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>dow of the impending tumult, he suspected
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>them<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_11_z008" data-origname="del">.</tei-del> to be impossible<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_11_z009" data-origname="del">impossible</tei-del> pictures.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He sprang from his bunk and began to
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pace nervously up and down the floor. "Good
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Gawd, what's the matter with me," he cried to
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>himself.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He felt that his laws of life were
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>useless. Whatever he had learned of him-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>self was now of no consequence. He was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_11_z010" data-origname="add">an</tei-add> unknown quantity. He would again be ob-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>liged to experiment, as he had in early youth,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and get upon his guard, else those qualities
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of which he knew nothing might everlastingly
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>disgrace him. "Good Gawd," he repeated.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_11_z011" data-origname="add">in dismay.</tei-add>
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>them<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_11_z008" data-origname="del">.</tei-del> to be impossible<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_11_z009" data-origname="del">impossible</tei-del> pictures.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He sprang from his bunk and began to
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pace nervously up and down the floor. "Good
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Gawd, what's the matter with me," he cried to
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>himself.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He felt that his laws of life were
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>useless. Whatever he had learned of him-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>self was now of no consequence. He was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_11_z010" data-origname="add">an</tei-add> unknown quantity. He would again be ob-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>liged to experiment, as he had in early youth,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and get upon his guard, else those qualities
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of which he knew nothing might everlastingly
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>disgrace him. "Good Gawd," he repeated.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_11_z011" data-origname="add">in dismay.</tei-add>
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_11" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_11_z001" data-origname="metamark">11</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>forced to admit that as far as war was con-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cerned he knew nothing of himself. Before <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_11_z002" data-origname="add">this,</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_11_z003" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he had never been obliged to grapple too seriously
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>with the question. He had taken certain
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>things for granted, even as in thoughts about
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his life, he had never <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_11_z005" data-origname="add">had</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_11_z006" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark> doubts of the ultimate
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>success of it and had bothered little about
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>means and roads.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But he was now suddenly confronted. As
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his imagination went forward to a fight, he
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>saw hideous possibilities. He contemplated the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>lurking menaces of the future and failed in
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>an effort to see himself standing stoutly
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in the midst of them. He recalled his <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_11_z007" data-origname="del">sha</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>visions of broken-bladed glory but in the sha-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>dow of the impending tumult, he suspected
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>them<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_11_z008" data-origname="del">.</tei-del> to be impossible<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_11_z009" data-origname="del">impossible</tei-del> pictures.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He sprang from his bunk and began to
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pace nervously up and down the floor. "Good
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Gawd, what's the matter with me," he cried to
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>himself.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He felt that his laws of life were
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>useless. Whatever he had learned of him-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>self was now of no consequence. He was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_11_z010" data-origname="add">an</tei-add> unknown quantity. He would again be ob-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>liged to experiment, as he had in early youth,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and get upon his guard, else those qualities
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of which he knew nothing might everlastingly
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>disgrace him. "Good Gawd," he repeated.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_11_z011" data-origname="add">in dismay.</tei-add>
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cerned he knew nothing of himself. Before <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_11_z002" data-origname="add">this,</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_11_z003" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he had never been obliged to grapple too seriously
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>with the question. He had taken certain
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>things for granted, even as in thoughts about
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his life, he had never <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_11_z005" data-origname="add">had</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_11_z006" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark> doubts of the ultimate
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>success of it and had bothered little about
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>means and roads.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But he was now suddenly confronted. As
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his imagination went forward to a fight, he
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>saw hideous possibilities. He contemplated the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>lurking menaces of the future and failed in

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>visions of broken-bladed glory but in the sha-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>dow of the impending tumult, he suspected
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>them<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_11_z008" data-origname="del">.</tei-del> to be impossible<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_11_z009" data-origname="del">impossible</tei-del> pictures.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He sprang from his bunk and began to
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pace nervously up and down the floor. "Good

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_12" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_12_z009" data-origname="metamark">12</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>After a time! Jim Conklin slid dexterously through
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the hole. Young Wilson followed. They were wrangling.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"That's all right," said Conklin waving his
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>hand impressively as he entered. "Yeh kin b'lieve
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>me er not--jest as yeh like. All yeh got t' do is
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t' sit down an' wait as quiet as yeh kin. Then
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pretty soon yeh'Il find out I was right."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Young Wilson grumbled stubbornly. "Well,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>yeh don't <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z007" data-origname="add">know</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z008" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark> everything in th' world, do yeh?"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Didn't say I knew everything in th' world,"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>replied Conklin sharply. He dumped <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z004" data-origname="del">everything</tei-del> <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z003" data-origname="add">the contents</tei-add>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z005" data-origname="del">from</tei-del> <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z006" data-origname="add">of</tei-add> his knapsack out upon floor and then
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>began to stow the things skilfully in again.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming looked down at the busy figure. "Goin'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t' be a battle sure, is there, Jim?" he asked.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Of course," said Conklin. "Of course! Yeh
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>jest wait 'til t'morrah an' yeh'll see th' bigges'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>battle ever was. Yeh jest wait."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Thunder," said Fleming.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Oh, yeh'll see figh tin' this time, m' boy, what'ill
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>be reg'lar fightin'," added Conklin with the air of a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>man who is about to exhibit a battle for the bene-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>fit of his friends.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Huh," said Wilson from a corner.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Well," remarked Fleming, "like as not this here
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>story will turn out jest like them others did."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Not much it won't," replied Conklin with exasper-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ation. "Th<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z002" data-origname="del">e</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z016" data-origname="add">'</tei-add> cavalry all started this morning, they
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>say. They say there aint hardly no <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_12_z001" data-origname="del">cala</tei-del> cavalry
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>left in camp. Th' reg'ments got orders, too. I seen
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>'em go t' head-quarters. Besides, they're raisin' blazes all
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>over camp--anybody kin see that."
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_12" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_12_z009" data-origname="metamark">12</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>After a time! Jim Conklin slid dexterously through
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the hole. Young Wilson followed. They were wrangling.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"That's all right," said Conklin waving his
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>hand impressively as he entered. "Yeh kin b'lieve
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>me er not--jest as yeh like. All yeh got t' do is
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t' sit down an' wait as quiet as yeh kin. Then
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pretty soon yeh'Il find out I was right."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Young Wilson grumbled stubbornly. "Well,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>yeh don't <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z007" data-origname="add">know</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z008" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark> everything in th' world, do yeh?"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Didn't say I knew everything in th' world,"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>replied Conklin sharply. He dumped <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z004" data-origname="del">everything</tei-del> <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z003" data-origname="add">the contents</tei-add>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z005" data-origname="del">from</tei-del> <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z006" data-origname="add">of</tei-add> his knapsack out upon floor and then
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>began to stow the things skilfully in again.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming looked down at the busy figure. "Goin'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t' be a battle sure, is there, Jim?" he asked.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Of course," said Conklin. "Of course! Yeh
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>jest wait 'til t'morrah an' yeh'll see th' bigges'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>battle ever was. Yeh jest wait."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Thunder," said Fleming.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Oh, yeh'll see figh tin' this time, m' boy, what'ill
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>be reg'lar fightin'," added Conklin with the air of a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>man who is about to exhibit a battle for the bene-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>fit of his friends.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Huh," said Wilson from a corner.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Well," remarked Fleming, "like as not this here
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>story will turn out jest like them others did."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Not much it won't," replied Conklin with exasper-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ation. "Th<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z002" data-origname="del">e</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z016" data-origname="add">'</tei-add> cavalry all started this morning, they
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>say. They say there aint hardly no <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_12_z001" data-origname="del">cala</tei-del> cavalry
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>left in camp. Th' reg'ments got orders, too. I seen
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>'em go t' head-quarters. Besides, they're raisin' blazes all
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>over camp--anybody kin see that."
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the hole. Young Wilson followed. They were wrangling.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"That's all right," said Conklin waving his
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>hand impressively as he entered. "Yeh kin b'lieve
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>me er not--jest as yeh like. All yeh got t' do is
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t' sit down an' wait as quiet as yeh kin. Then
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pretty soon yeh'Il find out I was right."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Young Wilson grumbled stubbornly. "Well,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>yeh don't <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z007" data-origname="add">know</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z008" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark> everything in th' world, do yeh?"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Didn't say I knew everything in th' world,"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>replied Conklin sharply. He dumped <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z004" data-origname="del">everything</tei-del> <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z003" data-origname="add">the contents</tei-add>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z005" data-origname="del">from</tei-del> <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z006" data-origname="add">of</tei-add> his knapsack out upon floor and then
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>began to stow the things skilfully in again.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming looked down at the busy figure. "Goin'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t' be a battle sure, is there, Jim?" he asked.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Of course," said Conklin. "Of course! Yeh
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>jest wait 'til t'morrah an' yeh'll see th' bigges'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>battle ever was. Yeh jest wait."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Thunder," said Fleming.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Oh, yeh'll see figh tin' this time, m' boy, what'ill
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>be reg'lar fightin'," added Conklin with the air of a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>man who is about to exhibit a battle for the bene-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>fit of his friends.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Huh," said Wilson from a corner.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Well," remarked Fleming, "like as not this here
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>story will turn out jest like them others did."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Not much it won't," replied Conklin with exasper-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ation. "Th<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z002" data-origname="del">e</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z016" data-origname="add">'</tei-add> cavalry all started this morning, they
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>say. They say there aint hardly no <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_12_z001" data-origname="del">cala</tei-del> cavalry
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>left in camp. Th' reg'ments got orders, too. I seen
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>'em go t' head-quarters. Besides, they're raisin' blazes all
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>over camp--anybody kin see that."
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pretty soon yeh'Il find out I was right."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Young Wilson grumbled stubbornly. "Well,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>yeh don't <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z007" data-origname="add">know</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z008" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark> everything in th' world, do yeh?"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Didn't say I knew everything in th' world,"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>replied Conklin sharply. He dumped <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z004" data-origname="del">everything</tei-del> <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z003" data-origname="add">the contents</tei-add>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z005" data-origname="del">from</tei-del> <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z006" data-origname="add">of</tei-add> his knapsack out upon floor and then
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>began to stow the things skilfully in again.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming looked down at the busy figure. "Goin'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t' be a battle sure, is there, Jim?" he asked.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Of course," said Conklin. "Of course! Yeh
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>jest wait 'til t'morrah an' yeh'll see th' bigges'
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>battle ever was. Yeh jest wait."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Thunder," said Fleming.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Oh, yeh'll see figh tin' this time, m' boy, what'ill
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>be reg'lar fightin'," added Conklin with the air of a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>man who is about to exhibit a battle for the bene-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>fit of his friends.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Huh," said Wilson from a corner.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Well," remarked Fleming, "like as not this here
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>story will turn out jest like them others did."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Not much it won't," replied Conklin with exasper-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ation. "Th<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z002" data-origname="del">e</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_12_z016" data-origname="add">'</tei-add> cavalry all started this morning, they
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>say. They say there aint hardly no <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_12_z001" data-origname="del">cala</tei-del> cavalry
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>left in camp. Th' reg'ments got orders, too. I seen
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>'em go t' head-quarters. Besides, they're raisin' blazes all
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>over camp--anybody kin see that."
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_13" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_13_z006" data-origname="metamark">13.</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Shucks," said Wilson.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming was silent for a time. At last, he spoke
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>to Conklin. "Jim!"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"What?"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"How d' yeh think th' regiment'll do?"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Oh, they'll fight all right, I guess, after they once
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>git inteh it," said Conklin with a fine use of the third person.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"There's been more or less fun made of 'em, 'cause they're
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>new, a' course, an' all that, but they'll fight good enough, I guess."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Think any th' boys'ill run?" persisted Fleming.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Oh, there maya few of 'em run but there's
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>them kind in ev'ry reg'ment, 'specially when they first
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>goes under fire," said Conklin in a tolerant way. "Of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>course, it might happen that th' hull kit an' boodle might
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>start and run<tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_13_z005" data-origname="del">.</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_13_z007" data-origname="add">,</tei-add> an', then ag'in, they might
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>stand and fight like fun. Yeh can't tell. Of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>course, they aint never been under fire yit an' it
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>aint likely they'll lick th' hull rebel army all-t'-onct,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>but they'll fight <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_13_z004" data-origname="del">like sin after they once</tei-del> better than
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>some if worser than others. That's th' way I figger.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Most of th' boys'll fight like sin after-they-onct-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>git-a-shootin'," he added with a mighty emphasis
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>on the four last words.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Oh, you think you know--" began Wilson with
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>scorn.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Conklin turned wrathfully upon him. They called
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>each other names.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming interrupted them. "Did yeh ever think
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>yeh might run yerself, Jim?," he asked. <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_13_z002" data-origname="del">He laughed</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_13_z003" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_13_z003" data-origname="del">o</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_13_z003" data-origname="add">O</tei-add></tei-subst>n concluding the sentence, he laughed as if he
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had meant to aim a joke.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming interrupted them. "Did yeh ever think
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>yeh might run yerself, Jim?," he asked. <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_13_z002" data-origname="del">He laughed</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_13_z003" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_13_z003" data-origname="del">o</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_13_z003" data-origname="add">O</tei-add></tei-subst>n concluding the sentence, he laughed as if he
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had meant to aim a joke.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Conklin turned wrathfully upon him. They called
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>each other names.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming interrupted them. "Did yeh ever think
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>yeh might run yerself, Jim?," he asked. <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_13_z002" data-origname="del">He laughed</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_13_z003" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_13_z003" data-origname="del">o</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_13_z003" data-origname="add">O</tei-add></tei-subst>n concluding the sentence, he laughed as if he
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had meant to aim a joke.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_13" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_13_z006" data-origname="metamark">13.</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Shucks," said Wilson.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming was silent for a time. At last, he spoke
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>to Conklin. "Jim!"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"What?"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"How d' yeh think th' regiment'll do?"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Oh, they'll fight all right, I guess, after they once
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>git inteh it," said Conklin with a fine use of the third person.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"There's been more or less fun made of 'em, 'cause they're
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>new, a' course, an' all that, but they'll fight good enough, I guess."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Think any th' boys'ill run?" persisted Fleming.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Oh, there maya few of 'em run but there's
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>them kind in ev'ry reg'ment, 'specially when they first
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>goes under fire," said Conklin in a tolerant way. "Of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>course, it might happen that th' hull kit an' boodle might
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>start and run<tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_13_z005" data-origname="del">.</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_13_z007" data-origname="add">,</tei-add> an', then ag'in, they might
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>stand and fight like fun. Yeh can't tell. Of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>course, they aint never been under fire yit an' it
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>aint likely they'll lick th' hull rebel army all-t'-onct,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>but they'll fight <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_13_z004" data-origname="del">like sin after they once</tei-del> better than
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>some if worser than others. That's th' way I figger.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Most of th' boys'll fight like sin after-they-onct-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>git-a-shootin'," he added with a mighty emphasis
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>on the four last words.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Oh, you think you know--" began Wilson with
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>scorn.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Conklin turned wrathfully upon him. They called
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>each other names.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming interrupted them. "Did yeh ever think
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>yeh might run yerself, Jim?," he asked. <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_13_z002" data-origname="del">He laughed</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_13_z003" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_13_z003" data-origname="del">o</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_13_z003" data-origname="add">O</tei-add></tei-subst>n concluding the sentence, he laughed as if he
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had meant to aim a joke.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_13" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_13_z006" data-origname="metamark">13.</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Shucks," said Wilson.

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>aint likely they'll lick th' hull rebel army all-t'-onct,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>but they'll fight <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_13_z004" data-origname="del">like sin after they once</tei-del> better than
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>some if worser than others. That's th' way I figger.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Most of th' boys'll fight like sin after-they-onct-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>git-a-shootin'," he added with a mighty emphasis
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>on the four last words.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Oh, you think you know--" began Wilson with
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>scorn.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Conklin turned wrathfully upon him. They called
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>each other names.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming interrupted them. "Did yeh ever think
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>yeh might run yerself, Jim?," he asked. <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_13_z002" data-origname="del">He laughed</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_13_z003" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_13_z003" data-origname="del">o</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_13_z003" data-origname="add">O</tei-add></tei-subst>n concluding the sentence, he laughed as if he
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had meant to aim a joke.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="1" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_14" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_14_z001" data-origname="metamark">14</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Conklin waved his hand. "Well," said he profoundly,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"I've thought it might git too hot fer Jim Conklin
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in some of them scrimmages an' if a hull lot of boys
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>started an' run", why, I s'pose I'd start an' run.<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_14_z002" data-origname="del">"</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But if e'rybody was a-standin' an' afightin, why,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>then, I'd stand an' fight. By jiminy, I would<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_14_z004" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_14_z004" data-origname="del">,</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_14_z004" data-origname="add">.</tei-add></tei-subst> I'll
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bet on it."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Huh," said Wilson.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>These words of Conklin, in a measure, re-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>assured Fleming.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="2" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_14" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_14_z001" data-origname="metamark">14</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Conklin waved his hand. "Well," said he profoundly,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"I've thought it might git too hot fer Jim Conklin
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in some of them scrimmages an' if a hull lot of boys
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>started an' run", why, I s'pose I'd start an' run.<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_14_z002" data-origname="del">"</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But if e'rybody was a-standin' an' afightin, why,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>then, I'd stand an' fight. By jiminy, I would<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_14_z004" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_14_z004" data-origname="del">,</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_14_z004" data-origname="add">.</tei-add></tei-subst> I'll
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bet on it."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Huh," said Wilson.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>These words of Conklin, in a measure, re-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>assured Fleming.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="2" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_14" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_14_z001" data-origname="metamark">14</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Conklin waved his hand. "Well," said he profoundly,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"I've thought it might git too hot fer Jim Conklin
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in some of them scrimmages an' if a hull lot of boys
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>started an' run", why, I s'pose I'd start an' run.<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_14_z002" data-origname="del">"</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But if e'rybody was a-standin' an' afightin, why,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>then, I'd stand an' fight. By jiminy, I would<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_14_z004" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_14_z004" data-origname="del">,</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_14_z004" data-origname="add">.</tei-add></tei-subst> I'll
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bet on it."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Huh," said Wilson.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>These words of Conklin, in a measure, re-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>assured Fleming.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="2" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_39" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>39<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>V<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_39_z019" data-origname="del">105</tei-del> There were moments of waiting. Fleming thought of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the village street at home before the arrival of the cir-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cus parade. He remembered how he <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_39_z013" data-origname="add">had</tei-add> stood a small
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>thrillful boy<tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_39_z018" data-origname="del">.</tei-del>, prepared to follow the band or the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>dingy lady upon the white <tei-restore change="dstX" hand="#SC" facs="#rboc-d_39_z014" data-origname="restore">s.h</tei-restore>orse. He saw the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>yellow road, the lines of expectant people, and
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the sober houses. He remembered an old fellow
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>who used to sit upon a cracker-box in front of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the store and fiegn to despise such exhibitions.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Some one cried: "Hear they come."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>There was a rustling and muttering among
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the men. They displayed a feverish desire to have
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_39_z006" data-origname="del">everything</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_39_z006" data-origname="add">all their munitions</tei-add> ready to their hands. Cartridge-boxes
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>were adjusted with great care. It was as if seven
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>hundred new bonnets were being <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_39_z015" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_39_z015" data-origname="del">s</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_39_z015" data-origname="add">t</tei-add></tei-subst>ried on. Gun-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>locks clicked.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Jim Conklin, having prepared himself, produced
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a red handkerchief. He was engaged in knotting
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>it accurately about his throat when the cry was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>repeated up and down the line: "Here they come!
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Here they come!"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Across the smoke-infested fields came a brown
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bunch of running men who were giving shrill yells.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>They came on stooping and swinging their rifles
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>at all angles. A flag, tilted forward, sped
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>near the front.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As he caught sight of them, Fleming was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>suddenly smitten with the <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_39-0001" data-origname="del">chanc</tei-del> thought
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that perhaps his rifle <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_39_z009" data-origname="del">wasn</tei-del> was not loaded.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="5" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_39" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>39<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>V<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_39_z019" data-origname="del">105</tei-del> There were moments of waiting. Fleming thought of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the village street at home before the arrival of the cir-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cus parade. He remembered how he <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_39_z013" data-origname="add">had</tei-add> stood a small
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>thrillful boy<tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_39_z018" data-origname="del">.</tei-del>, prepared to follow the band or the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>dingy lady upon the white <tei-restore change="dstX" hand="#SC" facs="#rboc-d_39_z014" data-origname="restore">s.h</tei-restore>orse. He saw the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>yellow road, the lines of expectant people, and
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the sober houses. He remembered an old fellow
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>who used to sit upon a cracker-box in front of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the store and fiegn to despise such exhibitions.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Some one cried: "Hear they come."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>There was a rustling and muttering among
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the men. They displayed a feverish desire to have
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_39_z006" data-origname="del">everything</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_39_z006" data-origname="add">all their munitions</tei-add> ready to their hands. Cartridge-boxes
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>were adjusted with great care. It was as if seven
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>hundred new bonnets were being <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_39_z015" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_39_z015" data-origname="del">s</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_39_z015" data-origname="add">t</tei-add></tei-subst>ried on. Gun-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>locks clicked.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Jim Conklin, having prepared himself, produced
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a red handkerchief. He was engaged in knotting
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>it accurately about his throat when the cry was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>repeated up and down the line: "Here they come!
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Here they come!"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Across the smoke-infested fields came a brown
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bunch of running men who were giving shrill yells.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>They came on stooping and swinging their rifles
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>at all angles. A flag, tilted forward, sped
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>near the front.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As he caught sight of them, Fleming was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>suddenly smitten with the <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_39-0001" data-origname="del">chanc</tei-del> thought
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that perhaps his rifle <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_39_z009" data-origname="del">wasn</tei-del> was not loaded.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="5" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>were adjusted with great care. It was as if seven
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>hundred new bonnets were being <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_39_z015" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_39_z015" data-origname="del">s</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_39_z015" data-origname="add">t</tei-add></tei-subst>ried on. Gun-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>locks clicked.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Jim Conklin, having prepared himself, produced
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a red handkerchief. He was engaged in knotting
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>it accurately about his throat when the cry was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>repeated up and down the line: "Here they come!
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Here they come!"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Across the smoke-infested fields came a brown
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bunch of running men who were giving shrill yells.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>They came on stooping and swinging their rifles
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>at all angles. A flag, tilted forward, sped
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>near the front.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As he caught sight of them, Fleming was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>suddenly smitten with the <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_39-0001" data-origname="del">chanc</tei-del> thought
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that perhaps his rifle <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_39_z009" data-origname="del">wasn</tei-del> was not loaded.

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the store and fiegn to despise such exhibitions.

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Across the smoke-infested fields came a brown

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that perhaps his rifle <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_39_z009" data-origname="del">wasn</tei-del> was not loaded.

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_40" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_40_z010" data-origname="metamark">40.</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>A hatless general pulled his dripping horse to a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>stand near the colonel of the 304th. He shook his
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>fist in the latter's face. "<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_40_z009" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_40_z009" data-origname="del">x</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_40_z009" data-origname="add">Y</tei-add></tei-subst>ou've got t' hold 'em back,"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he shouted savagely. "You've got t' hold 'em back."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>In his agitation, the colonel began to stam-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>mer. "A-all right, general, we-we'll d-do our b-best(.")
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The general made a passionate gesture and gal-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>loped away. The colonel, perchance as a woman
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>releaves her feelings with tears, began to swear
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>sweepingly. Fleming, turning swiftly to make sure
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that the rear was unmolested, saw the cursing
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cammander regarding his regiment in a very
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>resentful manner.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The man at Fleming's elbow was mumbling
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>as if to himself: "Oh, we're in for it now. We're
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in for it now."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The captain of the campany had been pac-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ing eXcitedly to and fro in the rear and had har-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>angued like a school-mistress: "Reserve your fire,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>boys--don't shoot 'til I tell you--save your fire
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>wait 'til they git close up--don't be damned fools."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Perspiration streamed down Fleming's face which
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>was soiled like <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_40_z001" data-origname="del">a crying urchins</tei-del> that of a crying urchin.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He frequently with a nervous movement wiped his eyes
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>with his coat sleeve.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He got a swift glance at the foe-swarming
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>field in front of him and, instantly, before he was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>quite ready to begin, before he had announced
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>to himself that he was about to fight, he threw
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the obedient, well-balanced rifle into position
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and fired a first, wild shot. Directly, he
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="5" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in for it now."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The captain of the campany had been pac-

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>wait 'til they git close up--don't be damned fools."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Perspiration streamed down Fleming's face which
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>was soiled like <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_40_z001" data-origname="del">a crying urchins</tei-del> that of a crying urchin.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He frequently with a nervous movement wiped his eyes
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>with his coat sleeve.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He got a swift glance at the foe-swarming
