<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_50" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab data-origname="ab">50<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The sound of the footsteps behind him gave him a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>certain, <tei-add place="above" rend="caret pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_50_z005" data-origname="add">meagre</tei-add> relief. The first clutchings of the dragons would
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>be <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_50_z004" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_50_z004" data-origname="del">uponof</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_50_z004" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add></tei-subst> the men <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_50_z002" data-origname="del">who</tei-del> were following him. He 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>displayed the zeal of a sprinter in his purpose to keep
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>them in the rear<tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_50_z003" data-origname="del" data-empty=""></tei-del>. There was a race.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Shells were hurtling over his head. He imagined
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>them to have rows of vindictively-grinning teeth turned
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>toward <tei-add place="above" rend="caret pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_50_z004" data-origname="add">him</tei-add> as they passed.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He experienced a thrill of amazement as he
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>passed the battery in the field back of the grove. The
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>artillerymen were going swiftly about their tasks. They
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>were continually bending in coaxing postures over the guns.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>They seemed to be patting them on the back and en-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>couraging them with words. The guns stolid and un-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>daunted, spoke with dogged valor.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The precise gunners were cool save for their
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>eyes which were lifted every chance toward <tei-restore change="dstX" hand="#SC" facs="#rboc-d_50_z009" data-origname="restore">a</tei-restore>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>smoked-wreathed hillock from whence a hostile bat-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tery addressed them. Fleming pitied them as he ran.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Methodical idiots! Machine-like fools! Staying to
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>be eaten up! The face of a youthful rider who was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>jerking his frantic horse with the abandon of tem-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>per he might display in a placid barn-yard was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>impressed deep upon his mind. He knew he looked
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="overwrite pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_50_z010" data-origname="del">upon</tei-del> a man who would presently be dead.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He saw a brigade going to the relief of it's
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pestered <tei-restore change="dstX" hand="#SC" facs="#rboc-d_50_z008" data-origname="restore">fellows</tei-restore>. He scrambled into some bushes and
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>watched it, sweeping finely, keeping formation in
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>difficult places. The blue of the line was crusted
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>with steel-color and brilliant flags projected.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Officers were shouting.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="6" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_51" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab data-origname="ab">  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>51  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>This Sight, also, filled him with wonder. The brigade 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>was hurrying briskly to be gulped into the infernal 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>mouth of the war-god. What kind of men were they, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_51_z001" data-origname="del">unho</tei-del>anyhow? Ab, it was some wondrous breed. Or<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_51_z002" data-origname="del">,</tei-del> 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>else they didn't know--the fools.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Some furious order had caused commotion in 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the <tei-del rend="strikethrough pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_51_z003" data-origname="del">battery</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_51_z004" data-origname="add">artillery</tei-add>. An officer on a bounding horse was 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>making maniacal motions with his arms. The teams 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_51_z005" data-origname="del">from the</tei-del>dashed up from the rear, the guns were 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>whirled about, and the battery <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_51_z006" data-origname="del">w</tei-del>scampered away. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The guns with their noses poked slantingly at the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ground, grumbled and grunted like stout men un
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>duly hurried.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming ran on.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Later he came upon a general of division seated 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>upon a horse that pricked it's ears in an interested way 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>at the battle. There was <tei-del rend="strikethrough pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_51_z007" data-origname="del">much</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_51_z008" data-origname="add">a great</tei-add> gleaming of yellow and 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>patent-leather about the saddle and bridle. The quiet 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>man astride looked mouse-colored upon such a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>splendid charger.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>A jingling staff was galloping hither and thither. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Sometimes, the general was surrounded by horsem<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_51_z010" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_51_z010" data-origname="del">a</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_51_z010" data-origname="add">e</tei-add></tei-subst>n and at 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>other times he was quite alone. He looked much har
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>assed. He had the appear�ance of a business man whose 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>market is swinging up and down.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming went slinking around the spot. He went 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>as near as he dared, trying to over-hear words. Per
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>haps, too, the general, un�able to comprehend chaos, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>might call upon him for information. And he
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="6" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming went slinking around the spot. He went 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>as near as he dared, trying to over-hear words. Per
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>haps, too, the general, un�able to comprehend chaos,

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_52" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="bottom" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="below" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z060" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>52<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>could tell him. He knew all about it. Of a surety, the 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>force was in a fix and any fool could see that if 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>they did not retreat while they <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z034" data-origname="add">had</tei-add> opportunity<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_52_z035" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z035" data-origname="del">.</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z035" data-origname="add">--</tei-add></tei-subst>why--
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He felt that he would like to thrash the general<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_52_z037" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z037" data-origname="del">.</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z037" data-origname="add">--</tei-add></tei-subst>
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>or at least<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z038" data-origname="del">go</tei-del>approach him<tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z039" data-origname="del">in</tei-del>and tell him in plain 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>words exactly what he thought him to be. It seemed 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>criminal to stay calmly in one spot and<tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z041" data-origname="del">may</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z042" data-origname="add">make</tei-add> no 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>effort to stay destruction.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As he went<tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z043" data-origname="del">nea</tei-del> warily nearer, he heard the 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>general call out irritably. "Tompkins, go over an' 
 <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>see Taylor an' tell him not to be in such a thun
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>derin' sweat--tell him t' halt his brigade in the 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>edge of th' woods.<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z044" data-origname="del">An' send</tei-del> Tell him t' detach a  
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>regment--tell him I think th' centre'ill break if 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>we--tell him t' hurry up."
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z046" data-origname="del">F'leming</tei-del>A moment later, Fleming saw the 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>general bounce excitedly in his saddle.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z047" data-origname="del">"No--yes</tei-del>
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Yes--no--yes." His face was aflame with 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>eagerness. "Yes--by Gawd--they've held 'im<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_52_z048" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z048" data-origname="del">.</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z048" data-origname="add">!</tei-add></tei-subst>They held 'im!"
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He began to blithely roar at his staff.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"We'll wallop 'em, now! We'll wallop '<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_52_z050" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z050" data-origname="del">i</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z050" data-origname="add">e</tei-add></tei-subst>m now! 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>We've got 'em!" Then<tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z051" data-origname="del">his eyes suddenly</tei-del> he turned 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>suddenly upon an aide. <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>force was in a fix and any fool could see that if 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>they did not retreat while they <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z034" data-origname="add">had</tei-add> opportunity<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_52_z035" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z035" data-origname="del">.</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z035" data-origname="add">--</tei-add></tei-subst>why--

<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>words exactly what he thought him to be. It seemed 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>criminal to stay calmly in one spot and<tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z041" data-origname="del">may</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z042" data-origname="add">make</tei-add> no

<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>general call out irritably. "Tompkins, go over an' 
 <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>see Taylor an' tell him not to be in such a thun
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>derin' sweat--tell him t' halt his brigade in the 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>edge of th' woods.<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z044" data-origname="del">An' send</tei-del> Tell him t' detach a  
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>regment--tell him I think th' centre'ill break if 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>we--tell him t' hurry up."
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z046" data-origname="del">F'leming</tei-del>A moment later, Fleming saw the 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>general bounce excitedly in his saddle.

<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Yes--no--yes." His face was aflame with 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>eagerness. <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He began to blithely roar at his staff.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"We'll wallop 'em, now! <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t' go in--everlastingly go in--go in like e

<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>force was in a fix and any fool could see that if 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>they did not retreat while they <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z034" data-origname="add">had</tei-add> opportunity<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_52_z035" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z035" data-origname="del">.</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z035" data-origname="add">--</tei-add></tei-subst>why--

 <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>see Taylor an' tell him not to be in such a thun
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>derin' sweat--tell him t' halt his brigade in the 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>edge of th' woods.<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z044" data-origname="del">An' send</tei-del> Tell him t' detach a

<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>we--tell him t' hurry up."

<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>force was in a fix and any fool could see that if 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>they did not retreat while they <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z034" data-origname="add">had</tei-add> opportunity<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_52_z035" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z035" data-origname="del">.</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z035" data-origname="add">--</tei-add></tei-subst>why--

 <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>see Taylor an' tell him not to be in such a thun
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>derin' sweat--tell him t' halt his brigade in the 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>edge of th' woods.<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z044" data-origname="del">An' send</tei-del> Tell him t' detach a

<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>we--tell him t' hurry up."

<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>force was in a fix and any fool could see that if 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>they did not retreat while they <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z034" data-origname="add">had</tei-add> opportunity<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_52_z035" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z035" data-origname="del">.</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z035" data-origname="add">--</tei-add></tei-subst>why--

 <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>see Taylor an' tell him not to be in such a thun
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>derin' sweat--tell him t' halt his brigade in the 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>edge of th' woods.<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z044" data-origname="del">An' send</tei-del> Tell him t' detach a

<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>we--tell him t' hurry up."

<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>force was in a fix and any fool could see that if 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>they did not retreat while they <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z034" data-origname="add">had</tei-add> opportunity<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_52_z035" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z035" data-origname="del">.</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z035" data-origname="add">--</tei-add></tei-subst>why--

 <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>see Taylor an' tell him not to be in such a thun
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>derin' sweat--tell him t' halt his brigade in the 
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>edge of th' woods.<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_52_z044" data-origname="del">An' send</tei-del> Tell him t' detach a

<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>we--tell him t' hurry up."

<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t' go in--everlastingly go in--go in like e
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ternal damnation."

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_53" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="bottom" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="below" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_53_z006" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"> <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>53 <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>VII.<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming cringed as if discovered at a crime. By heav-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ens, they had won after all. That embecile line had remain
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ed<tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_53_z007" data-origname="add">and</tei-add> become victors. He could hear the cheering.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He lifted himself upon his toes and looked in the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>direction of the fight. A vast yellow cloud lay wallow-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ing on the tree-tops. From beneath <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_53_z001" data-origname="del"><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_53_z001" data-origname="metamark">cam</tei-metamark></tei-del>it came the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>clatter of musketry. The <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_53_z002" data-origname="del"><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_53_z002" data-origname="metamark">cheers</tei-metamark></tei-del>hoarse cheers told of an
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>advance.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He turned away, sulky and angry. He felt that 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he had been wronged.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He had fled, he told himself, because annihilation 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>was approaching. He had done his part in saving himself 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>who was a little piece of the army. He had considered the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>time, he said, to be one in which it was the duty of ev-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ery little piece to rescue itself if possible. Later, the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>officers could put the little pieces together again and 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>make a battle-front. <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_53_z003" data-origname="del"><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_53_z003" data-origname="metamark">J</tei-metamark></tei-del>If no little pieces were wise 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>enough to <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_53_z004" data-origname="del"><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_53_z004" data-origname="metamark">rescue</tei-metamark></tei-del>save themselves from the flurry of 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>death at such a time, why, then, were would the army 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>be? It was all very plain that he had proceeded 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>according to very correct and commendable rules. His 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>actions had been sagacious things. They were full of strategy.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He thought of his comrades. They had staid and 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>won. It seemed that the blind ignorance and stupid
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ity of those little pieces had betrayed him. He had 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>been over-turned and crushed by their lack of sense 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in holding a position that a little thought would 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>have convinced them to be impossible. He, the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>enlightened, had fled because of his superior know-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ledge. He felt a great anger against his comrades.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="7" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_53" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="bottom" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="below" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_53_z006" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"> <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>53 <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>VII.<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming cringed as if discovered at a crime. By heav-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ens, they had won after all. That embecile line had remain
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ed<tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_53_z007" data-origname="add">and</tei-add> become victors. He could hear the cheering.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He lifted himself upon his toes and looked in the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>direction of the fight. A vast yellow cloud lay wallow-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ing on the tree-tops. From beneath <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_53_z001" data-origname="del"><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_53_z001" data-origname="metamark">cam</tei-metamark></tei-del>it came the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>clatter of musketry. The <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_53_z002" data-origname="del"><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_53_z002" data-origname="metamark">cheers</tei-metamark></tei-del>hoarse cheers told of an
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>advance.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He turned away, sulky and angry. He felt that 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he had been wronged.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He had fled, he told himself, because annihilation 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>was approaching. He had done his part in saving himself 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>who was a little piece of the army. He had considered the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>time, he said, to be one in which it was the duty of ev-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ery little piece to rescue itself if possible. Later, the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>officers could put the little pieces together again and 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>make a battle-front. <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_53_z003" data-origname="del"><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_53_z003" data-origname="metamark">J</tei-metamark></tei-del>If no little pieces were wise 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>enough to <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_53_z004" data-origname="del"><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_53_z004" data-origname="metamark">rescue</tei-metamark></tei-del>save themselves from the flurry of 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>death at such a time, why, then, were would the army 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>be? It was all very plain that he had proceeded 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>according to very correct and commendable rules. His 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>actions had been sagacious things. They were full of strategy.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He thought of his comrades. They had staid and 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>won. It seemed that the blind ignorance and stupid
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ity of those little pieces had betrayed him. He had 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>been over-turned and crushed by their lack of sense 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in holding a position that a little thought would 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>have convinced them to be impossible. He, the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>enlightened, had fled because of his superior know-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ledge. He felt a great anger against his comrades.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="7" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ens, they had won after all. That embecile line had remain
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ed<tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_53_z007" data-origname="add">and</tei-add> become victors. He could hear the cheering.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He lifted himself upon his toes and looked in the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>direction of the fight. A vast yellow cloud lay wallow-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ing on the tree-tops. From beneath <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_53_z001" data-origname="del"><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_53_z001" data-origname="metamark">cam</tei-metamark></tei-del>it came the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>clatter of musketry. The <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_53_z002" data-origname="del"><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_53_z002" data-origname="metamark">cheers</tei-metamark></tei-del>hoarse cheers told of an
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>advance.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He turned away, sulky and angry. He felt that 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he had been wronged.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He had fled, he told himself, because annihilation 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>was approaching. He had done his part in saving himself 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>who was a little piece of the army. He had considered the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>time, he said, to be one in which it was the duty of ev-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ery little piece to rescue itself if possible. Later, the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>officers could put the little pieces together again and 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>make a battle-front. <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_53_z003" data-origname="del"><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_53_z003" data-origname="metamark">J</tei-metamark></tei-del>If no little pieces were wise 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>enough to <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_53_z004" data-origname="del"><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_53_z004" data-origname="metamark">rescue</tei-metamark></tei-del>save themselves from the flurry of 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>death at such a time, why, then, were would the army 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>be? It was all very plain that he had proceeded 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>according to very correct and commendable rules. His 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>actions had been sagacious things. They were full of strategy.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He thought of his comrades. They had staid and 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>won. It seemed that the blind ignorance and stupid
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ity of those little pieces had betrayed him. He had 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>been over-turned and crushed by their lack of sense 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in holding a position that a little thought would 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>have convinced them to be impossible. He, the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>enlightened, had fled because of his superior know-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ledge. He felt a great anger against his comrades.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="7" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_55" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
<tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-add place="margin-left" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_55_z013" data-origname="add">arms</tei-add> <tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_55_z014" data-origname="add">.</tei-add> <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_55_z001" data-origname="del">with re-</tei-del><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_55_z003" data-origname="del">proach</tei-del> <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_55_z007" data-origname="del">brought</tei-del> <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_55_z008" data-origname="del">Itreenforced</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_55_z016" data-origname="add">re</tei-add><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_55_z009" data-origname="del">dive</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>55
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>arms and turned their face-leaves toward him.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He dreaded lest these voices and noisy
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>motions would bring men to look at him.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He went far, seeking dark and intricate places.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The musketry grew faint and the cannon boomed in the distance.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The sun, suddenly apparent, blazed among the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>trees. The in�sects were making rythmical noises. They
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>seemed to be grinding their teeth in unison. A woodpecker
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>stuck his insolent head around the side of a tree. A
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bird flew on light-hearted wing.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Off was the rumble of death. It seemed now that
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>nature had no ears.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>This landscape gave him assurance. It was the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>religion of peace. It would die if it's timid eyes were
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>compelled to see blood. He concieved nature to be a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>woman with a deep aversion to tragedy.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He threw a pine-cone at a jovial and pot-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>valiant squirrel and it ran with chattering fear.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>There was the law, he thought. Nature had given him
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a sign.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He wended feeling that nature agreed with him.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It reinforced his arguments with proofs
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that lived where the sun shone.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He found himself almost into a swamp once.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He was obliged to walk on bog-tufts and watch
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his feet to keep from the oily mire. Pausing
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>once to look about him, he saw, out on some black
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>water, a small animal pounce in and
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>emerge directly with a silver-gleaming fish. Pres-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ently, he was again in the deep thickets. The
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>brushed branches made a noise that drowned
</tei-ab><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="" facs="#rboc-d_56_z012" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_56_z002" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_56_z004" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_56_z010" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_56_z010" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_56_z011" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add><tei-milestone n="7" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>religion of peace. It would die if it's timid eyes were
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>compelled to see blood. He concieved nature to be a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>woman with a deep aversion to tragedy.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He threw a pine-cone at a jovial and pot-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>valiant squirrel and it ran with chattering fear.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>There was the law, he thought. Nature had given him
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a sign.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He wended feeling that nature agreed with him.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It reinforced his arguments with proofs
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that lived where the sun shone.

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He was obliged to walk on bog-tufts and watch

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_55" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
<tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-add place="margin-left" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_55_z013" data-origname="add">arms</tei-add> <tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_55_z014" data-origname="add">.</tei-add> <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_55_z001" data-origname="del">with re-</tei-del><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_55_z003" data-origname="del">proach</tei-del> <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_55_z007" data-origname="del">brought</tei-del> <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_55_z008" data-origname="del">Itreenforced</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_55_z016" data-origname="add">re</tei-add><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_55_z009" data-origname="del">dive</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>55
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>arms and turned their face-leaves toward him.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He dreaded lest these voices and noisy
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>motions would bring men to look at him.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He went far, seeking dark and intricate places.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The musketry grew faint and the cannon boomed in the distance.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The sun, suddenly apparent, blazed among the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>trees. The in�sects were making rythmical noises. They
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>seemed to be grinding their teeth in unison. A woodpecker
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>stuck his insolent head around the side of a tree. A
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bird flew on light-hearted wing.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Off was the rumble of death. It seemed now that
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>nature had no ears.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>This landscape gave him assurance. It was the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>religion of peace. It would die if it's timid eyes were
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>compelled to see blood. He concieved nature to be a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>woman with a deep aversion to tragedy.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He threw a pine-cone at a jovial and pot-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>valiant squirrel and it ran with chattering fear.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>There was the law, he thought. Nature had given him
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a sign.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He wended feeling that nature agreed with him.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It reinforced his arguments with proofs
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that lived where the sun shone.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He found himself almost into a swamp once.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He was obliged to walk on bog-tufts and watch
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his feet to keep from the oily mire. Pausing
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>once to look about him, he saw, out on some black
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>water, a small animal pounce in and
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>emerge directly with a silver-gleaming fish. Pres-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ently, he was again in the deep thickets. The
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>brushed branches made a noise that drowned
</tei-ab><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="" facs="#rboc-d_56_z012" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_56_z002" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_56_z004" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_56_z010" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_56_z010" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_56_z011" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add><tei-milestone n="7" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>water, a small animal pounce in and
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>emerge directly with a silver-gleaming fish. Pres-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ently, he was again in the deep thickets. The
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>brushed branches made a noise that drowned
</tei-ab><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="" facs="#rboc-d_56_z012" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_56_z002" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_56_z004" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_56_z010" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_56_z010" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_56_z011" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add><tei-milestone n="7" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_55" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
<tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-add place="margin-left" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_55_z013" data-origname="add">arms</tei-add> <tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_55_z014" data-origname="add">.</tei-add> <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_55_z001" data-origname="del">with re-</tei-del><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_55_z003" data-origname="del">proach</tei-del> <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_55_z007" data-origname="del">brought</tei-del> <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_55_z008" data-origname="del">Itreenforced</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_55_z016" data-origname="add">re</tei-add><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_55_z009" data-origname="del">dive</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>55
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>arms and turned their face-leaves toward him.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He dreaded lest these voices and noisy
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>motions would bring men to look at him.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He went far, seeking dark and intricate places.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The musketry grew faint and the cannon boomed in the distance.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The sun, suddenly apparent, blazed among the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>trees. The in�sects were making rythmical noises. They
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>seemed to be grinding their teeth in unison. A woodpecker
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>stuck his insolent head around the side of a tree. A
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bird flew on light-hearted wing.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Off was the rumble of death. It seemed now that
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>nature had no ears.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>This landscape gave him assurance. It was the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>religion of peace. It would die if it's timid eyes were
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>compelled to see blood. He concieved nature to be a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>woman with a deep aversion to tragedy.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He threw a pine-cone at a jovial and pot-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>valiant squirrel and it ran with chattering fear.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>There was the law, he thought. Nature had given him
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a sign.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He wended feeling that nature agreed with him.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It reinforced his arguments with proofs
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that lived where the sun shone.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He found himself almost into a swamp once.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He was obliged to walk on bog-tufts and watch
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his feet to keep from the oily mire. Pausing
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>once to look about him, he saw, out on some black
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>water, a small animal pounce in and
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>emerge directly with a silver-gleaming fish. Pres-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ently, he was again in the deep thickets. The
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>brushed branches made a noise that drowned
</tei-ab><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="" facs="#rboc-d_56_z012" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_56_z002" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_56_z004" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_56_z010" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_56_z010" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_56_z011" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add><tei-milestone n="7" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_56" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
<tei-ab data-origname="ab">
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>56
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the sounds of cannon.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He went on, going from obscurity to promises
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of a greater obscurity.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>At length, he reached a place where the high,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>arching boughs made a chapel. SHe softly pushed the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>green doors aside and entered. Pine-needles were a gentle
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>brown carpet. There was a religious half-light.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Near the threshold, he stopped horror-stricken
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>at the sight of a thing.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He was being looked at by a dead man who was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>seated with his back against a treecolumn-like tree.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The corpse was dressed in a uniform that once had
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>been blue but itwas now faded to a melancholy green.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The eyes, staring at Fleming, had changed to the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>dull hue to be seen on the side of a dead fish.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The mouth was opened. It's red had changed to an
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>apalling yellow. Over the grey skin of the face ran
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>little ants. One was trundling some sort of a bundle
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>along the upper lip.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming gave a shriek as he confronted the thing.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He was for an instant turned to stone before it. He
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>remained staring into the dulled,liquid-looking eyes.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Then, he cautiously put one hand behind him and
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>touched a tree. Leaning upon this he retreated step
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>by step with his face still toward the thing. He feared
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that if he turned his back, the thing might spring
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>up and stealthily pursue him.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The branches, pushing against him, threatened
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>to pushthrow him over upon it. His unguided feet, too,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>caught aggravatingly in brambles. And, hewithal, he recieved
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a subtle suggestion to touch the corpse. As he
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="8" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The branches, pushing against him, threatened
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>to pushthrow him over upon it. His unguided feet, too,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>caught aggravatingly in brambles. And, hewithal, he recieved
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a subtle suggestion to touch the corpse. As he
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="8" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_56" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>
<tei-ab data-origname="ab">
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>56
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the sounds of cannon.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He went on, going from obscurity to promises
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of a greater obscurity.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>At length, he reached a place where the high,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>arching boughs made a chapel. SHe softly pushed the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>green doors aside and entered. Pine-needles were a gentle
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>brown carpet. There was a religious half-light.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Near the threshold, he stopped horror-stricken
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>at the sight of a thing.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He was being looked at by a dead man who was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>seated with his back against a treecolumn-like tree.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The corpse was dressed in a uniform that once had
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>been blue but itwas now faded to a melancholy green.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The eyes, staring at Fleming, had changed to the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>dull hue to be seen on the side of a dead fish.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The mouth was opened. It's red had changed to an
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>apalling yellow. Over the grey skin of the face ran
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>little ants. One was trundling some sort of a bundle
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>along the upper lip.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming gave a shriek as he confronted the thing.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He was for an instant turned to stone before it. He
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>remained staring into the dulled,liquid-looking eyes.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Then, he cautiously put one hand behind him and
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>touched a tree. Leaning upon this he retreated step
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>by step with his face still toward the thing. He feared
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that if he turned his back, the thing might spring
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>up and stealthily pursue him.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The branches, pushing against him, threatened
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>to pushthrow him over upon it. His unguided feet, too,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>caught aggravatingly in brambles. And, hewithal, he recieved
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a subtle suggestion to touch the corpse. As he
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="8" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_59" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>59<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>VIII<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The trees began softly to sing an evening hymn. The 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bur�nished sun sank until slanted bronze rays struck 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the tree-tops. There was a lull in the noise of insects 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>as if they had bowed their beaks and were making a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>devotional pause. There was silence save for the chanted
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>chorus of the trees.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Upon this stillness there suddenly broke a tre-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>mendous clangor of sounds. A crimson roar came from the distance.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming paused. He was transfixed by this terrific medley
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of all noises. It was as if worlds were being rended. The
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ripping of musketry was mingled with the breaking 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>crash of the <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_59_z001" data-origname="del"><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_59_z001" data-origname="metamark">artillery</tei-metamark></tei-del> cannon.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>His mind flew in all directions. He concieved
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the two armies to be at each other panther-wise. He 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>listened for a time. Then he began to run in the dir-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ection of the battle. He saw that it was an ironical 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>thing for him to be running thus toward that which 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he had been at such pains to avoid. But he said, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_59_z002" data-origname="del"><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_59_z002" data-origname="metamark">to himself</tei-metamark>,</tei-del> in sub�stance, to himself that if the earth 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and moon were about to clash together, many would
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>plan to get upon roofs to witness the collision.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As he ran, he was aware that the forest had 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>stopped it's music as if at last becoming capable of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>hearing the foriegn sounds. The trees hushed and 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bended forward. Everything seemed to be listening 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>to the crackle and <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_59_z003" data-origname="del"><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_59_z003" data-origname="metamark">clamo</tei-metamark></tei-del> clatter of the infantry fir-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ing and the ear-shaking thunder of the artillery. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The chorus pealed over the still earth.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="8" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_59" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>59<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>VIII<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The trees began softly to sing an evening hymn.   <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ripping of musketry was mingled with the breaking

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the two armies to be at each other panther-wise. He 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>listened for a time. Then he began to run in the dir-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ection of the battle. He saw that it was an ironical 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>thing for him to be running thus toward that which 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he had been at such pains to avoid. But he said, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_59_z002" data-origname="del"><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_59_z002" data-origname="metamark">to himself</tei-metamark>,</tei-del> in sub�stance, to himself that if the earth 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and moon were about to clash together, many would
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>plan to get upon roofs to witness the collision.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As he ran, he was aware that the forest had 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>stopped it's music as if at last becoming capable of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>hearing the foriegn sounds. The trees hushed and 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bended forward. Everything seemed to be listening 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>to the crackle and <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_59_z003" data-origname="del"><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_59_z003" data-origname="metamark">clamo</tei-metamark></tei-del> clatter of the infantry fir-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ing and the ear-shaking thunder of the artillery. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The chorus pealed over the still earth.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="8" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>
