  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he had been at such pains to avoid. But he said, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_59_z002" data-origname="del"><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_59_z002" data-origname="metamark">to himself</tei-metamark>,</tei-del> in sub�stance, to himself that if the earth 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and moon were about to clash together, many would
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>plan to get upon roofs to witness the collision.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As he ran, he was aware that the forest had 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>stopped it's music as if at last becoming capable of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>hearing the foriegn sounds. The trees hushed and 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bended forward. Everything seemed to be listening 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>to the crackle and <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_59_z003" data-origname="del"><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_59_z003" data-origname="metamark">clamo</tei-metamark></tei-del> clatter of the infantry fir-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ing and the ear-shaking thunder of the artillery. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The chorus pealed over the still earth.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="8" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_59" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>59<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>VIII<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The trees began softly to sing an evening hymn. The 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bur�nished sun sank until slanted bronze rays struck 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the tree-tops. There was a lull in the noise of insects 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>as if they had bowed their beaks and were making a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>devotional pause. There was silence save for the chanted
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>chorus of the trees.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Upon this stillness there suddenly broke a tre-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>mendous clangor of sounds. A crimson roar came from the distance.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming paused. He was transfixed by this terrific medley
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of all noises. It was as if worlds were being rended. The
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ripping of musketry was mingled with the breaking 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>crash of the <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_59_z001" data-origname="del"><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_59_z001" data-origname="metamark">artillery</tei-metamark></tei-del> cannon.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>His mind flew in all directions. He concieved
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the two armies to be at each other panther-wise. He 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>listened for a time. Then he began to run in the dir-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ection of the battle. He saw that it was an ironical 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>thing for him to be running thus toward that which 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he had been at such pains to avoid. But he said, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_59_z002" data-origname="del"><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_59_z002" data-origname="metamark">to himself</tei-metamark>,</tei-del> in sub�stance, to himself that if the earth 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and moon were about to clash together, many would
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>plan to get upon roofs to witness the collision.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As he ran, he was aware that the forest had 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>stopped it's music as if at last becoming capable of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>hearing the foriegn sounds. The trees hushed and 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bended forward. Everything seemed to be listening 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>to the crackle and <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_59_z003" data-origname="del"><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_59_z003" data-origname="metamark">clamo</tei-metamark></tei-del> clatter of the infantry fir-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ing and the ear-shaking thunder of the artillery. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The chorus pealed over the still earth.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="8" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_60" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_60_z018" data-origname="metamark">60</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It occurred to him that the fight he had been in, was,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>after all, but perfunctory <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z001" data-origname="add">popping</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z019" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark>. In the hearing of this present
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>din, he was doubtful if he had seen real <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z002" data-origname="del">war</tei-del>battle-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>scenes. Reflecting, he saw a sort <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z003" data-origname="del">of a</tei-del>humor in the point
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of view of he and his fellows during that encounter. They
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had taken themselves and the enemy very seriously and
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had imagined that they were deciding the war. Individuals
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>might have supposed that they were cutting the letters
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of their names deep into everlasting tablets of brass
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>or enshrining their reputations forever in the hearts of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>their countrymen, while, as to fact, the affair would
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>appear in reports under a <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z004" data-origname="del">curious</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z005" data-origname="add">meek</tei-add> and <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z006" data-origname="del">meek</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z014" data-origname="add">immaterial</tei-add> title.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But he saw that it was good, else, he said, in battle ev-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>eryone would doubtless run save for lorn hope and their ilk.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He went rapidly <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z007" data-origname="del">on</tei-del>on. He wanted <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z008" data-origname="add">to</tei-add> come to the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>edge of the forest and peer out.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As he hurried, there passed through his mind
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pictures of stupendous struggles. All his accumulations
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>upon such subjects were used to form scenes. The up-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>roar was as <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="del">a</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="add">t</tei-add></tei-subst>he voice of an eloquent being describing.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Sometimes, the brambles formed chains and held
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>him back. Trees, confronting him stretched out their
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>arms and forbade him to pass. <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z009" data-origname="del">It seemed to him</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z010" data-origname="del">that</tei-del>He thought with a fine bitterness that nature
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>could not be quite ready to kill him yet.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But he took roundabout ways. Presently he was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in a place from which he could see long fringes
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of smoke where battle-lines lay. The voices of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the cannon shook him. He stood for a moment
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and watched. His <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z011" data-origname="del">I</tei-del>eyes had an awe-struck ex-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pression. His lower jaw hung down.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="8" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_60" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_60_z018" data-origname="metamark">60</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It occurred to him that the fight he had been in, was,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>after all, but perfunctory <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z001" data-origname="add">popping</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z019" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark>. In the hearing of this present
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>din, he was doubtful if he had seen real <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z002" data-origname="del">war</tei-del>battle-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>scenes. Reflecting, he saw a sort <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z003" data-origname="del">of a</tei-del>humor in the point
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of view of he and his fellows during that encounter. They
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had taken themselves and the enemy very seriously and
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had imagined that they were deciding the war. Individuals
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>might have supposed that they were cutting the letters
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of their names deep into everlasting tablets of brass
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>or enshrining their reputations forever in the hearts of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>their countrymen, while, as to fact, the affair would
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>appear in reports under a <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z004" data-origname="del">curious</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z005" data-origname="add">meek</tei-add> and <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z006" data-origname="del">meek</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z014" data-origname="add">immaterial</tei-add> title.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But he saw that it was good, else, he said, in battle ev-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>eryone would doubtless run save for lorn hope and their ilk.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He went rapidly <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z007" data-origname="del">on</tei-del>on. He wanted <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z008" data-origname="add">to</tei-add> come to the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>edge of the forest and peer out.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As he hurried, there passed through his mind
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pictures of stupendous struggles. All his accumulations
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>upon such subjects were used to form scenes. The up-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>roar was as <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="del">a</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="add">t</tei-add></tei-subst>he voice of an eloquent being describing.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Sometimes, the brambles formed chains and held
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>him back. Trees, confronting him stretched out their
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>arms and forbade him to pass. <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z009" data-origname="del">It seemed to him</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z010" data-origname="del">that</tei-del>He thought with a fine bitterness that nature
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>could not be quite ready to kill him yet.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But he took roundabout ways. Presently he was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in a place from which he could see long fringes
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of smoke where battle-lines lay. The voices of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the cannon shook him. He stood for a moment
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and watched. His <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z011" data-origname="del">I</tei-del>eyes had an awe-struck ex-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pression. His lower jaw hung down.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="8" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>their countrymen, while, as to fact, the affair would
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>appear in reports under a <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z004" data-origname="del">curious</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z005" data-origname="add">meek</tei-add> and <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z006" data-origname="del">meek</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z014" data-origname="add">immaterial</tei-add> title.

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He went rapidly <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z007" data-origname="del">on</tei-del>on.   <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pictures of stupendous struggles. All his accumulations
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>upon such subjects were used to form scenes. The up-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>roar was as <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="del">a</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="add">t</tei-add></tei-subst>he voice of an eloquent being describing.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Sometimes, the brambles formed chains and held
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>him back. Trees, confronting him stretched out their
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>arms and forbade him to pass. <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z009" data-origname="del">It seemed to him</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z010" data-origname="del">that</tei-del>He thought with a fine bitterness that nature
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>could not be quite ready to kill him yet.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But he took roundabout ways. Presently he was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in a place from which he could see long fringes
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of smoke where battle-lines lay. The voices of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the cannon shook him. He stood for a moment
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and watched. His <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z011" data-origname="del">I</tei-del>eyes had an awe-struck ex-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pression. His lower jaw hung down.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="8" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_60" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_60_z018" data-origname="metamark">60</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It occurred to him that the fight he had been in, was,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>after all, but perfunctory <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z001" data-origname="add">popping</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z019" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark>. In the hearing of this present
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>din, he was doubtful if he had seen real <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z002" data-origname="del">war</tei-del>battle-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>scenes. Reflecting, he saw a sort <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z003" data-origname="del">of a</tei-del>humor in the point
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of view of he and his fellows during that encounter. They
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had taken themselves and the enemy very seriously and
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had imagined that they were deciding the war. Individuals
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>might have supposed that they were cutting the letters
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of their names deep into everlasting tablets of brass
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>or enshrining their reputations forever in the hearts of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>their countrymen, while, as to fact, the affair would
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>appear in reports under a <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z004" data-origname="del">curious</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z005" data-origname="add">meek</tei-add> and <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z006" data-origname="del">meek</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z014" data-origname="add">immaterial</tei-add> title.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But he saw that it was good, else, he said, in battle ev-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>eryone would doubtless run save for lorn hope and their ilk.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He went rapidly <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z007" data-origname="del">on</tei-del>on. He wanted <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z008" data-origname="add">to</tei-add> come to the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>edge of the forest and peer out.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As he hurried, there passed through his mind
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pictures of stupendous struggles. All his accumulations
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>upon such subjects were used to form scenes. The up-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>roar was as <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="del">a</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="add">t</tei-add></tei-subst>he voice of an eloquent being describing.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Sometimes, the brambles formed chains and held
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>him back. Trees, confronting him stretched out their
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>arms and forbade him to pass. <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z009" data-origname="del">It seemed to him</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z010" data-origname="del">that</tei-del>He thought with a fine bitterness that nature
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>could not be quite ready to kill him yet.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But he took roundabout ways. Presently he was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in a place from which he could see long fringes
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of smoke where battle-lines lay. The voices of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the cannon shook him. He stood for a moment
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and watched. His <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z011" data-origname="del">I</tei-del>eyes had an awe-struck ex-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pression. His lower jaw hung down.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="8" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of their names deep into everlasting tablets of brass
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>or enshrining their reputations forever in the hearts of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>their countrymen, while, as to fact, the affair would
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>appear in reports under a <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z004" data-origname="del">curious</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z005" data-origname="add">meek</tei-add> and <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z006" data-origname="del">meek</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z014" data-origname="add">immaterial</tei-add> title.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But he saw that it was good, else, he said, in battle ev-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>eryone would doubtless run save for lorn hope and their ilk.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He went rapidly <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z007" data-origname="del">on</tei-del>on. He wanted <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z008" data-origname="add">to</tei-add> come to the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>edge of the forest and peer out.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As he hurried, there passed through his mind
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pictures of stupendous struggles. All his accumulations
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>upon such subjects were used to form scenes. The up-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>roar was as <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="del">a</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="add">t</tei-add></tei-subst>he voice of an eloquent being describing.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Sometimes, the brambles formed chains and held
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>him back. Trees, confronting him stretched out their
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>arms and forbade him to pass. <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z009" data-origname="del">It seemed to him</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z010" data-origname="del">that</tei-del>He thought with a fine bitterness that nature
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>could not be quite ready to kill him yet.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But he took roundabout ways. Presently he was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in a place from which he could see long fringes
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of smoke where battle-lines lay. The voices of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the cannon shook him. He stood for a moment
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and watched. His <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z011" data-origname="del">I</tei-del>eyes had an awe-struck ex-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pression. His lower jaw hung down.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="8" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_60" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_60_z018" data-origname="metamark">60</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It occurred to him that the fight he had been in, was,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>after all, but perfunctory <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z001" data-origname="add">popping</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z019" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark>. In the hearing of this present
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>din, he was doubtful if he had seen real <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z002" data-origname="del">war</tei-del>battle-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>scenes. Reflecting, he saw a sort <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z003" data-origname="del">of a</tei-del>humor in the point
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of view of he and his fellows during that encounter. They
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had taken themselves and the enemy very seriously and
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had imagined that they were deciding the war. Individuals
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>might have supposed that they were cutting the letters
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of their names deep into everlasting tablets of brass
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>or enshrining their reputations forever in the hearts of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>their countrymen, while, as to fact, the affair would
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>appear in reports under a <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z004" data-origname="del">curious</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z005" data-origname="add">meek</tei-add> and <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z006" data-origname="del">meek</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z014" data-origname="add">immaterial</tei-add> title.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But he saw that it was good, else, he said, in battle ev-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>eryone would doubtless run save for lorn hope and their ilk.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He went rapidly <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z007" data-origname="del">on</tei-del>on. He wanted <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z008" data-origname="add">to</tei-add> come to the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>edge of the forest and peer out.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As he hurried, there passed through his mind
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pictures of stupendous struggles. All his accumulations
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>upon such subjects were used to form scenes. The up-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>roar was as <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="del">a</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="add">t</tei-add></tei-subst>he voice of an eloquent being describing.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Sometimes, the brambles formed chains and held
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>him back. Trees, confronting him stretched out their
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>arms and forbade him to pass. <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z009" data-origname="del">It seemed to him</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z010" data-origname="del">that</tei-del>He thought with a fine bitterness that nature
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>could not be quite ready to kill him yet.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But he took roundabout ways. Presently he was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in a place from which he could see long fringes
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of smoke where battle-lines lay. The voices of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the cannon shook him. He stood for a moment
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and watched. His <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z011" data-origname="del">I</tei-del>eyes had an awe-struck ex-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pression. His lower jaw hung down.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="8" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="8" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_60" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_60_z018" data-origname="metamark">60</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It occurred to him that the fight he had been in, was,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>after all, but perfunctory <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z001" data-origname="add">popping</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z019" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark>. In the hearing of this present
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>din, he was doubtful if he had seen real <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z002" data-origname="del">war</tei-del>battle-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>scenes. Reflecting, he saw a sort <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z003" data-origname="del">of a</tei-del>humor in the point
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of view of he and his fellows during that encounter. They
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had taken themselves and the enemy very seriously and
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had imagined that they were deciding the war. Individuals
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>might have supposed that they were cutting the letters
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of their names deep into everlasting tablets of brass
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>or enshrining their reputations forever in the hearts of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>their countrymen, while, as to fact, the affair would
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>appear in reports under a <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z004" data-origname="del">curious</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z005" data-origname="add">meek</tei-add> and <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z006" data-origname="del">meek</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z014" data-origname="add">immaterial</tei-add> title.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But he saw that it was good, else, he said, in battle ev-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>eryone would doubtless run save for lorn hope and their ilk.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He went rapidly <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z007" data-origname="del">on</tei-del>on. He wanted <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z008" data-origname="add">to</tei-add> come to the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>edge of the forest and peer out.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As he hurried, there passed through his mind
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pictures of stupendous struggles. All his accumulations
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>upon such subjects were used to form scenes. The up-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>roar was as <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="del">a</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="add">t</tei-add></tei-subst>he voice of an eloquent being describing.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Sometimes, the brambles formed chains and held
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>him back. Trees, confronting him stretched out their
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>arms and forbade him to pass. <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z009" data-origname="del">It seemed to him</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z010" data-origname="del">that</tei-del>He thought with a fine bitterness that nature
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>could not be quite ready to kill him yet.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But he took roundabout ways. Presently he was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in a place from which he could see long fringes
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of smoke where battle-lines lay. The voices of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the cannon shook him. He stood for a moment
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and watched. His <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z011" data-origname="del">I</tei-del>eyes had an awe-struck ex-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pression. His lower jaw hung down.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="8" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But he saw that it was good, else, he said, in battle ev-

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>edge of the forest and peer out.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As he hurried, there passed through his mind
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pictures of stupendous struggles. All his accumulations
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>upon such subjects were used to form scenes. The up-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>roar was as <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="del">a</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="add">t</tei-add></tei-subst>he voice of an eloquent being describing.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Sometimes, the brambles formed chains and held
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>him back. Trees, confronting him stretched out their
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>arms and forbade him to pass. <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z009" data-origname="del">It seemed to him</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z010" data-origname="del">that</tei-del>He thought with a fine bitterness that nature
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>could not be quite ready to kill him yet.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But he took roundabout ways. Presently he was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in a place from which he could see long fringes
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of smoke where battle-lines lay. The voices of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the cannon shook him. He stood for a moment
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and watched. His <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z011" data-origname="del">I</tei-del>eyes had an awe-struck ex-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pression. His lower jaw hung down.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="8" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_60" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_60_z018" data-origname="metamark">60</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It occurred to him that the fight he had been in, was,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>after all, but perfunctory <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z001" data-origname="add">popping</tei-add><tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z019" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark>. In the hearing of this present
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>din, he was doubtful if he had seen real <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z002" data-origname="del">war</tei-del>battle-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>scenes. Reflecting, he saw a sort <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z003" data-origname="del">of a</tei-del>humor in the point
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of view of he and his fellows during that encounter. They
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had taken themselves and the enemy very seriously and
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had imagined that they were deciding the war. Individuals
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>might have supposed that they were cutting the letters
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of their names deep into everlasting tablets of brass
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>or enshrining their reputations forever in the hearts of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>their countrymen, while, as to fact, the affair would
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>appear in reports under a <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z004" data-origname="del">curious</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z005" data-origname="add">meek</tei-add> and <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z006" data-origname="del">meek</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z014" data-origname="add">immaterial</tei-add> title.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But he saw that it was good, else, he said, in battle ev-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>eryone would doubtless run save for lorn hope and their ilk.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He went rapidly <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z007" data-origname="del">on</tei-del>on. He wanted <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z008" data-origname="add">to</tei-add> come to the
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>edge of the forest and peer out.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As he hurried, there passed through his mind
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pictures of stupendous struggles. All his accumulations
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>upon such subjects were used to form scenes. The up-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>roar was as <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="del">a</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z017" data-origname="add">t</tei-add></tei-subst>he voice of an eloquent being describing.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Sometimes, the brambles formed chains and held
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>him back. Trees, confronting him stretched out their
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>arms and forbade him to pass. <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z009" data-origname="del">It seemed to him</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z010" data-origname="del">that</tei-del>He thought with a fine bitterness that nature
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>could not be quite ready to kill him yet.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But he took roundabout ways. Presently he was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in a place from which he could see long fringes
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of smoke where battle-lines lay. The voices of
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the cannon shook him. He stood for a moment
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and watched. His <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_60_z011" data-origname="del">I</tei-del>eyes had an awe-struck ex-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pression. His lower jaw hung down.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="8" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_64" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>64<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>yeh hit, ol' boy?" he asked in a brotherly way.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming was startled by this question although at 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>first it's full import was not born in upon him.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"What?" he asked. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Where yeh hit?" repeated the tattered man.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Why," began Fleming, "I--I--that is--why--"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He turned away suddenly and slid through the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>crowd.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The tattered man looked after him in astonishment.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="9" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_66" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_66_z001" data-origname="metamark">66</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_66_z002" data-origname="del">waxlike</tei-del><tei-add place="margin-left" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_66_z003" data-origname="add">wax-like</tei-add> face toward him, Fleming screamed.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Gawd! Jim Conklin!"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Conklin made a little common-place smile. "Hello, Flem,"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he said.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming swayed on his legs and glared wildly. He stut-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tered and stammered. "Oh, Jim--oh, Jim--oh, Jim"--
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Conklin held out his <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z005" data-origname="del">bloody</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z014" data-origname="add">gory</tei-add> hand. On it was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a curious red and black combination of <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z007" data-origname="del">old</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z006" data-origname="add">new</tei-add> blood and
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>old blood. "Where yeh been<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_66_z008" data-origname="del">?</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_66_z015" data-origname="add">,</tei-add> Flem<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_66_z016" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z016" data-origname="del">,</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z016" data-origname="add">?</tei-add></tei-subst>" he asked. He <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z009" data-origname="del">went</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>continued in a monotonous voice. "I thought mebbe yeh
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>got <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z010" data-origname="del">kelle</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z017" data-origname="add">keeled</tei-add> over. I was worryin' about it a good deal."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming still lamented. "Oh, Jim--oh, Jim<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_66_z011" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_66_z011" data-origname="del">,</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_66_z011" data-origname="add">--</tei-add></tei-subst>oh, Jim"--�
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Yeh know," said Conklin, "I was out there." He made
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a careful gesture. "An', Lord, what a circus. An',
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>b'jiminy, I got shot--I got shot."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming put forth anxious arms to assist his friend
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>but the latter went firmly on as if propelled.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Suddenly, as they went, Conklin seemed to be
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>overcome by a terror. His face turned to a sem-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>blance of grey paste. He clutched Flemings arm
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and began to talk to him in a shaking voice.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"I'll tell yeh what I'm <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_66_z012" data-origname="del">a</tei-del>'fraid of, Flem--I'll
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tell yeh what I'm 'fraid of. I'll fall down--an', then,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>yeh know--them damned artillery wagons--they
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>like as not ull run over me--thats what I'm 'fraid of."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming cried out to him hysterically. "I'll take
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>keer of yeh, Jim. I'll take keer of yeh."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Sure yeh will, Flem?" beseeched Conklin.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Yes, yes, I'll take keer of yeh, Jim," protested
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming. He could not speak <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z013" data-origname="del">be</tei-del> accurately because
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of the great gulpings in his throat.</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="9" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_66" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_66_z001" data-origname="metamark">66</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_66_z002" data-origname="del">waxlike</tei-del><tei-add place="margin-left" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_66_z003" data-origname="add">wax-like</tei-add> face toward him, Fleming screamed.

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>old blood.   <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Gawd! Jim Conklin!"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Conklin made a little common-place smile. "Hello, Flem,"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he said.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming swayed on his legs and glared wildly. He stut-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tered and stammered. "Oh, Jim--oh, Jim--oh, Jim"--
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Conklin held out his <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z005" data-origname="del">bloody</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z014" data-origname="add">gory</tei-add> hand. On it was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a curious red and black combination of <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z007" data-origname="del">old</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z006" data-origname="add">new</tei-add> blood and
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>old blood. He <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z009" data-origname="del">went</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>continued in a monotonous voice. "I thought mebbe yeh
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>got <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z010" data-origname="del">kelle</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z017" data-origname="add">keeled</tei-add> over.   <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming still lamented.   <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>b'jiminy, I got shot--I got shot."

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>but the latter went firmly on as if propelled.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Suddenly, as they went, Conklin seemed to be
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>overcome by a terror. His face turned to a sem-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>blance of grey paste. He clutched Flemings arm
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and began to talk to him in a shaking voice.

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>like as not ull run over me--thats what I'm 'fraid of."

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>keer of yeh, Jim. I'll take keer of yeh."

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming. He could not speak <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z013" data-origname="del">be</tei-del> accurately because
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of the great gulpings in his throat.</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="9" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_66" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_66_z001" data-origname="metamark">66</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_66_z002" data-origname="del">waxlike</tei-del><tei-add place="margin-left" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_66_z003" data-origname="add">wax-like</tei-add> face toward him, Fleming screamed.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Gawd! Jim Conklin!"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Conklin made a little common-place smile. "Hello, Flem,"
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he said.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming swayed on his legs and glared wildly. He stut-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tered and stammered. "Oh, Jim--oh, Jim--oh, Jim"--
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Conklin held out his <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z005" data-origname="del">bloody</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z014" data-origname="add">gory</tei-add> hand. On it was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a curious red and black combination of <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z007" data-origname="del">old</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z006" data-origname="add">new</tei-add> blood and
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>old blood. "Where yeh been<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_66_z008" data-origname="del">?</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_66_z015" data-origname="add">,</tei-add> Flem<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_66_z016" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z016" data-origname="del">,</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z016" data-origname="add">?</tei-add></tei-subst>" he asked. He <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z009" data-origname="del">went</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>continued in a monotonous voice. "I thought mebbe yeh
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>got <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z010" data-origname="del">kelle</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z017" data-origname="add">keeled</tei-add> over. I was worryin' about it a good deal."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming still lamented. "Oh, Jim--oh, Jim<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_66_z011" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_66_z011" data-origname="del">,</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_66_z011" data-origname="add">--</tei-add></tei-subst>oh, Jim"--�
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Yeh know," said Conklin, "I was out there." He made
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a careful gesture. "An', Lord, what a circus. An',
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>b'jiminy, I got shot--I got shot."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming put forth anxious arms to assist his friend
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>but the latter went firmly on as if propelled.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Suddenly, as they went, Conklin seemed to be
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>overcome by a terror. His face turned to a sem-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>blance of grey paste. He clutched Flemings arm
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and began to talk to him in a shaking voice.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"I'll tell yeh what I'm <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_66_z012" data-origname="del">a</tei-del>'fraid of, Flem--I'll
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tell yeh what I'm 'fraid of. I'll fall down--an', then,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>yeh know--them damned artillery wagons--they
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>like as not ull run over me--thats what I'm 'fraid of."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming cried out to him hysterically. "I'll take
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>keer of yeh, Jim. I'll take keer of yeh."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Sure yeh will, Flem?" beseeched Conklin.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Yes, yes, I'll take keer of yeh, Jim," protested
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming. He could not speak <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z013" data-origname="del">be</tei-del> accurately because
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of the great gulpings in his throat.</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="9" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

"Oh, Jim--oh, Jim<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_66_z011" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_66_z011" data-origname="del">,</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_66_z011" data-origname="add">--</tei-add></tei-subst>oh, Jim"--�
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Yeh know," said Conklin, "I was out there." He made
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a careful gesture. "An', Lord, what a circus. An',
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>b'jiminy, I got shot--I got shot."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming put forth anxious arms to assist his friend
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>but the latter went firmly on as if propelled.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Suddenly, as they went, Conklin seemed to be
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>overcome by a terror. His face turned to a sem-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>blance of grey paste. He clutched Flemings arm
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and began to talk to him in a shaking voice.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"I'll tell yeh what I'm <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_66_z012" data-origname="del">a</tei-del>'fraid of, Flem--I'll
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tell yeh what I'm 'fraid of. I'll fall down--an', then,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>yeh know--them damned artillery wagons--they
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>like as not ull run over me--thats what I'm 'fraid of."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming cried out to him hysterically. "I'll take
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>keer of yeh, Jim. I'll take keer of yeh."
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Sure yeh will, Flem?" beseeched Conklin.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Yes, yes, I'll take keer of yeh, Jim," protested
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming. He could not speak <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_66_z013" data-origname="del">be</tei-del> accurately because
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of the great gulpings in his throat.</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="9" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_67" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_67_z022" data-origname="metamark">67</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Conklin still begged in a lowly way. His eyes rolled.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He hung babe-like to Fleming. “I was allus a good
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>friend of your’n, wasn’t I, Flem<tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_67_z002" data-origname="del"><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_67_z001" data-origname="del">i</tei-del>ng</tei-del>? An’ it aint much
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>t’ ask, is it, Flem? Jest t’ drag me outa th’ road.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>I’d do it fur you, wouldn’t I, Flem?” <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_67_z003" data-origname="del">And keep</tei-del>
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming’s anguish reached <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_67_z005" data-origname="del">the</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_67_z004" data-origname="add">a</tei-add>heat where <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_67_z006" data-origname="del">the</tei-del>scorch-
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ing sobs shook his chest, but, suddenly Conklin seemed
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>to forget all those fears. He became again the
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>grim stalking spectre of a soldier. He went
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>stonily forward. Fleming <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_67_z024" data-origname="del">, striding</tei-del>wished his friend
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>to lean upon him but the other always shook his
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>head and strangely protested. <tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_67_z026" data-origname="add">"No-- no-- leave me be-- leave me be."</tei-add>
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>His <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_67_z009" data-origname="del">eyes</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_67_z010" data-origname="add">look</tei-add> again <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_67_z011" data-origname="del">became</tei-del> was fixed upon
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the unknown. He moved with mysteri<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_67_z025" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_67_z025" data-origname="del">os</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_67_z025" data-origname="add">ous</tei-add></tei-subst> purpose.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>And all of Fleming's offers he brushed aside. "No--
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>no-- leave me be-- leave me be--"
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming had to follow after.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_67_z012" data-origname="del">At last</tei-del>Presently, the latter heard <tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_67_z014" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark> <tei-add place="inline" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_67_z015" data-origname="add">a</tei-add> voice talk-
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ing softly near his shoulder. Turning, he saw that
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>it belonged to the tattered <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_67_z017" data-origname="del">man.</tei-del> <tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_67_z018" data-origname="add">soldier.</tei-add> "Ye'd better
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tak'im outa th' road, pardner. There's a bat'try com-
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in' helitywhoop an' he'll git run over. He's goner any-
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>how in about five minutes-- yeh kin see that. Ye'd
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>better tak'im outa th' road<tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_67_z019" data-origname="add">.</tei-add> <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_67_z020" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_67_z020" data-origname="del">w</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_67_z020" data-origname="add">W</tei-add></tei-subst>here th' blazes does he
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>git his stren'th from?"
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Lord knows," cried Fleming. He  was shaking
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his hands helplessly.
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He ran forward and grasped Conklin by the
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>arm. "Jim<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_67_z021" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_67_z021" data-origname="del">,</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_67_z021" data-origname="add">--</tei-add></tei-subst>Jim," he coaxed, "come with me."
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="9" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>it belonged to the tattered <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_67_z017" data-origname="del">man.</tei-del> <tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_67_z018" data-origname="add">soldier.</tei-add> "Ye'd better

<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>how in about five minutes-- yeh kin see that. Ye'd
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>better tak'im outa th' road<tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_67_z019" data-origname="add">.</tei-add> <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_67_z020" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_67_z020" data-origname="del">w</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_67_z020" data-origname="add">W</tei-add></tei-subst>here th' blazes does he
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>git his stren'th from?"
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Lord knows," cried Fleming. He  was shaking
<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his hands helplessly.

<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>arm. <tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_67" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_67_z022" data-origname="metamark">67</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Conklin still begged in a lowly way.
