  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As the flap of the blue jacket fell away
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>from the body, he could see that the side
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>looked as if it had been chewed by wolves.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming turned toward the battle ground. His
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>hands were clenched<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_70_z011" data-origname="del">.</tei-del> and a rage was upon his
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>face. He seemed about to deliver a phillipic.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Hell"--
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstB" facs="#rboc-d_70_z012" data-origname="del">fierce</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstB" facs="#rboc-d_70_z013" data-origname="add">red</tei-add> sun was pasted in the sky like
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a fierce wafer.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="10" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_70" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_70_z003" data-origname="metamark">70</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_70_z001" data-origname="del">Finally</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_70_z002" data-origname="add">Presently,</tei-add> he seemed invaded by a creeping ague
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that gradually enveloped him. For a moment,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the tremor of his legs made him dance a sort of a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>hideous horn-pipe. His arms beat wildly about his
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>head. His tall figure grew <tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dStX" facs="#rboc-d_70_z007" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_70_z005" data-origname="add">suddenly</tei-add> to <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_70_z006" data-origname="del">sudden</tei-del> unnatural
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>proportions then it began to swing slowly forward
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>like a falling tree. A last muscular contortion
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>caused the left shoulder to <tei-metamark place="inline" function="caret" rend="ink" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_70_z007" data-origname="metamark">^</tei-metamark><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_70_z008" data-origname="add">first</tei-add> strike the ground<tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_70_z010" data-origname="add">.</tei-add> <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_70_z009" data-origname="del">fir</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The body seemed to bounce a little way from
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the earth. "Gawd," said the tattered soldier.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming had watched, spell-bound, these
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>rites of a departing life, this dance of death.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>His face had been twisted into every form of agony
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that he had imagined for his friend.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He now sprang to his <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_70_z014" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_70_z014" data-origname="del">a</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_70_z014" data-origname="add">feet</tei-add></tei-subst> and gazed at
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the paste-like face. The mouth was open and
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the teeth showed in a laugh.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As the flap of the blue jacket fell away
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>from the body, he could see that the side
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>looked as if it had been chewed by wolves.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Fleming turned toward the battle ground. His
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>hands were clenched<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_70_z011" data-origname="del">.</tei-del> and a rage was upon his
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>face. He seemed about to deliver a phillipic.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>"Hell"--
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstB" facs="#rboc-d_70_z012" data-origname="del">fierce</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstB" facs="#rboc-d_70_z013" data-origname="add">red</tei-add> sun was pasted in the sky like
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a fierce wafer.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="10" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_75" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>75<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Promptly, his old rebellious feelings returned. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He thought the powers of fate had combined to 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>heap misfortune upon him. He was a victim.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He rebelled against the source of things, ac-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cording to his law that the most powerful should 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>recieve the most blame.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>War, he said<tei-del rend="overwrite ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z027" data-origname="del">,</tei-del> bitterly to the sky, was a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>make-shift created because ordinary processes 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>didn't furnish deaths enough. To seduce her vic-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tims, nature had to formulate a beautiful ex-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cuse. She made glory. This made the men<tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z028" data-origname="del"> a</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>willing, anxious, in haste, to come and be killed.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>And, with heavy <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z029" data-origname="del">satire</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z031" data-origname="add">humor</tei-add>, he thought of how 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>nature must smile when she the men come 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>running. They regarding <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z032" data-origname="del">ardor ardor</tei-del>, war-fire 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and courage as holy things and did not see 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that nature had placed them in hearts because 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>virtuous indignation would not last through a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>black struggle. Men would grow tired of it. They 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would go home.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>They must be inspired by some<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z033" data-origname="del">thing</tei-del> 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>sentiment that <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z034" data-origname="del">would enable</tei-del>they could call sa-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cred and enshrine in their heart, something that 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z035" data-origname="del">make</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z036" data-origname="add">cause</tei-add> them to regard slaughter as fine 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and go at it cheerfully<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z037" data-origname="del">.</tei-del>; something that could 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z039" data-origname="del">out shadow all the</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z040" data-origname="add">destroy all the bindings of</tei-add> loves and places that tie 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>men's hearts. She made glory.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>From his pinnacle of wisdom, he regarded 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the armies as large collection of dupes. Nature's 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>dupes, who were killing each other to carry out
</tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-add place="margin-top" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z001" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add>76</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="10" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_75" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>75<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Promptly, his old rebellious feelings returned.

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>willing, anxious, in haste, to come and be killed.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>And, with heavy <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z029" data-origname="del">satire</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z031" data-origname="add">humor</tei-add>, he thought of how 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>nature must smile when she the men come 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>running. They regarding <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z032" data-origname="del">ardor ardor</tei-del>, war-fire 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and courage as holy things and did not see 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that nature had placed them in hearts because 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>virtuous indignation would not last through a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>black struggle. Men would grow tired of it. They 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would go home.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>They must be inspired by some<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z033" data-origname="del">thing</tei-del> 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>sentiment that <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z034" data-origname="del">would enable</tei-del>they could call sa-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cred and enshrine in their heart, something that 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z035" data-origname="del">make</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z036" data-origname="add">cause</tei-add> them to regard slaughter as fine 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and go at it cheerfully<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z037" data-origname="del">.</tei-del>; something that could 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z039" data-origname="del">out shadow all the</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z040" data-origname="add">destroy all the bindings of</tei-add> loves and places that tie 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>men's hearts. She made glory.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>From his pinnacle of wisdom, he regarded 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the armies as large collection of dupes. Nature's 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>dupes, who were killing each other to carry out
</tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-add place="margin-top" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z001" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add>76</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="10" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>heap misfortune upon him. He was a victim.

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>recieve the most blame.

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cuse. She made glory. This made the men<tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z028" data-origname="del"> a</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>willing, anxious, in haste, to come and be killed.

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>running. They regarding <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z032" data-origname="del">ardor ardor</tei-del>, war-fire 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and courage as holy things and did not see 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that nature had placed them in hearts because

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>black struggle. Men would grow tired of it. They 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would go home.

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z035" data-origname="del">make</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z036" data-origname="add">cause</tei-add> them to regard slaughter as fine

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>heap misfortune upon him. He was a victim.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He rebelled against the source of things, ac-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cording to his law that the most powerful should 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>recieve the most blame.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>War, he said<tei-del rend="overwrite ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z027" data-origname="del">,</tei-del> bitterly to the sky, was a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>make-shift created because ordinary processes 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>didn't furnish deaths enough. To seduce her vic-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tims, nature had to formulate a beautiful ex-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cuse. She made glory. This made the men<tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z028" data-origname="del"> a</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>willing, anxious, in haste, to come and be killed.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>And, with heavy <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z029" data-origname="del">satire</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z031" data-origname="add">humor</tei-add>, he thought of how 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>nature must smile when she the men come 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>running. They regarding <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z032" data-origname="del">ardor ardor</tei-del>, war-fire 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and courage as holy things and did not see 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that nature had placed them in hearts because 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>virtuous indignation would not last through a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>black struggle. Men would grow tired of it. They 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would go home.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>They must be inspired by some<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z033" data-origname="del">thing</tei-del> 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>sentiment that <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z034" data-origname="del">would enable</tei-del>they could call sa-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cred and enshrine in their heart, something that 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z035" data-origname="del">make</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z036" data-origname="add">cause</tei-add> them to regard slaughter as fine 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and go at it cheerfully<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z037" data-origname="del">.</tei-del>; something that could 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z039" data-origname="del">out shadow all the</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z040" data-origname="add">destroy all the bindings of</tei-add> loves and places that tie 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>men's hearts. She made glory.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>From his pinnacle of wisdom, he regarded 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the armies as large collection of dupes. Nature's 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>dupes, who were killing each other to carry out
</tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-add place="margin-top" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z001" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add>76</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="10" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>didn't furnish deaths enough. To seduce her vic-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tims, nature had to formulate a beautiful ex-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cuse. She made glory. This made the men<tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z028" data-origname="del"> a</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>willing, anxious, in haste, to come and be killed.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>And, with heavy <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z029" data-origname="del">satire</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z031" data-origname="add">humor</tei-add>, he thought of how 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>nature must smile when she the men come 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>running. They regarding <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z032" data-origname="del">ardor ardor</tei-del>, war-fire 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and courage as holy things and did not see 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that nature had placed them in hearts because 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>virtuous indignation would not last through a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>black struggle. Men would grow tired of it. They 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would go home.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>They must be inspired by some<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z033" data-origname="del">thing</tei-del> 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>sentiment that <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z034" data-origname="del">would enable</tei-del>they could call sa-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cred and enshrine in their heart, something that 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z035" data-origname="del">make</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z036" data-origname="add">cause</tei-add> them to regard slaughter as fine 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and go at it cheerfully<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z037" data-origname="del">.</tei-del>; something that could 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z039" data-origname="del">out shadow all the</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_75_z040" data-origname="add">destroy all the bindings of</tei-add> loves and places that tie 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>men's hearts. She made glory.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>From his pinnacle of wisdom, he regarded 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the armies as large collection of dupes. Nature's 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>dupes, who were killing each other to carry out
</tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-add place="margin-top" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z001" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add>76</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="10" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_76" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>76<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>some great scheme of life. They were under the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>impression that they were fighting for principles and 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>honor and homes and various things.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Well, to be sure<tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z002" data-origname="add">;</tei-add> they were.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Nature w<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_76_z003" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z003" data-origname="del">i</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z003" data-origname="add">a</tei-add></tei-subst>s miraculously skilful in concocting 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>excuses, he thought, with a heavy, theatrical contempt. <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z005" data-origname="del">And it was</tei-del><tei-add place="below" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z011" data-origname="add">It could deck a</tei-add> hideous creature <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z006" data-origname="del">decked</tei-del>in enticing apparel. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>When he saw how <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z007" data-origname="del">they</tei-del>she <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z008" data-origname="del">had cozened him</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z009" data-origname="del">out of his home</tei-del>, as a women beckons, had cozened 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>him out of his home and hoodwinked him into 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>wielding a rifle, he went into a rage.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He turned in tupenny <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z010" data-origname="del">furr</tei-del>fury upon the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>high, tranquil sky. He would have like to 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>have splashed it with a derisive paint.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>And he was bitter that among all men, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he should be the only one sufficiently wise to 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>understand these things.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="11" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>impression that they were fighting for principles and 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>honor and homes and various things.

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Nature w<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_76_z003" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z003" data-origname="del">i</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z003" data-origname="add">a</tei-add></tei-subst>s miraculously skilful in concocting 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>excuses, he thought, with a heavy, theatrical contempt. <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z005" data-origname="del">And it was</tei-del><tei-add place="below" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z011" data-origname="add">It could deck a</tei-add> hideous creature <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z006" data-origname="del">decked</tei-del>in enticing apparel. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>When he saw how <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z007" data-origname="del">they</tei-del>she <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z008" data-origname="del">had cozened him</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z009" data-origname="del">out of his home</tei-del>, as a women beckons, had cozened 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>him out of his home and hoodwinked him into 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>wielding a rifle, he went into a rage.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He turned in tupenny <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z010" data-origname="del">furr</tei-del>fury upon the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>high, tranquil sky. He would have like to 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>have splashed it with a derisive paint.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>And he was bitter that among all men, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he should be the only one sufficiently wise to

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_76" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>76<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>some great scheme of life.   <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>excuses, he thought, with a heavy, theatrical contempt. <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z005" data-origname="del">And it was</tei-del><tei-add place="below" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z011" data-origname="add">It could deck a</tei-add> hideous creature <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z006" data-origname="del">decked</tei-del>in enticing apparel.

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_76_z009" data-origname="del">out of his home</tei-del>, as a women beckons, had cozened

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_78" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>78<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>enemy. They felt the pride of their onward movement when 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the whole army seemed trying to dribble down this road. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>They tumbled teams about with a fine feeling that it was 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>no matter so long as their column got to the front in time. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>This importance made their <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z001" data-origname="del">column</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z014" data-origname="add">faces</tei-add> stern and quiet, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and the backs of the officers were very rigid.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As he looked at them, Fleming knew all of his
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>woe. He felt that he was regarding a procession of 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>chosen beings. The separation was as great to him as 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>if they had marched with weapons of flame and 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>banners of sunlight. He could never be like them. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He could have wept in his longings.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He searched about in his mind then for a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>proper malediction for the indefinite cause, that 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>thing <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z017" data-origname="del">to</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z016" data-origname="add">upon</tei-add> which men turn the words of final blame. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It was responsible for him. There lay the fault.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The haste of the column to reach the battle-ground 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>struck forlorn Fleming as being something <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z008" data-origname="del">more</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z007" data-origname="add">much finer</tei-add> than stout 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="overwrite pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z018" data-origname="del">st</tei-del>fighting. Heroes he thought, could find excuses in that 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>long, seething l<tei-del rend="overwrite pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z020" data-origname="del">i</tei-del>ane. They could retire with perfect 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>self-respect and make explanations to the stars.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He wondered what those men <tei-add place="above" rend="caret pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z012" data-origname="add">^had eaten</tei-add> that <tei-del rend="overwrite ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z013" data-origname="del">cothey</tei-del> could be so 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bitter to force their ways to chances of death. As he watched 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his envy grew until he wished to change lives with one of them. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He would have like to have used a tremendous force, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>thrown off himself and became a better. Swift picture 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of himself apart yet in himself came to him--a blue 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>desperate figure leading lurid charges with one knee 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>forward and a broken blade high -- a blue 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>determined figure standing before a crimson and steel 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>assault getting calmly killed on a high place before

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_78" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>78<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>enemy. They felt the pride of their onward movement when 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the whole army seemed trying to dribble down this road. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>They tumbled teams about with a fine feeling that it was 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>no matter so long as their column got to the front in time. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>This importance made their <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z001" data-origname="del">column</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z014" data-origname="add">faces</tei-add> stern and quiet, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and the backs of the officers were very rigid.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As he looked at them, Fleming knew all of his
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>woe. He felt that he was regarding a procession of 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>chosen beings. The separation was as great to him as 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>if they had marched with weapons of flame and 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>banners of sunlight. He could never be like them. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He could have wept in his longings.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He searched about in his mind then for a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>proper malediction for the indefinite cause, that 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>thing <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z017" data-origname="del">to</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z016" data-origname="add">upon</tei-add> which men turn the words of final blame. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It was responsible for him. There lay the fault.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The haste of the column to reach the battle-ground 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>struck forlorn Fleming as being something <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z008" data-origname="del">more</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z007" data-origname="add">much finer</tei-add> than stout 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="overwrite pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z018" data-origname="del">st</tei-del>fighting. Heroes he thought, could find excuses in that 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>long, seething l<tei-del rend="overwrite pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z020" data-origname="del">i</tei-del>ane. They could retire with perfect 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>self-respect and make explanations to the stars.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He wondered what those men <tei-add place="above" rend="caret pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z012" data-origname="add">^had eaten</tei-add> that <tei-del rend="overwrite ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z013" data-origname="del">cothey</tei-del> could be so 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bitter to force their ways to chances of death. As he watched 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his envy grew until he wished to change lives with one of them. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He would have like to have used a tremendous force, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>thrown off himself and became a better. Swift picture 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of himself apart yet in himself came to him--a blue 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>desperate figure leading lurid charges with one knee 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>forward and a broken blade high -- a blue 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>determined figure standing before a crimson and steel 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>assault getting calmly killed on a high place before
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="11" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_78" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>78<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>enemy. They felt the pride of their onward movement when 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the whole army seemed trying to dribble down this road. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>They tumbled teams about with a fine feeling that it was 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>no matter so long as their column got to the front in time. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>This importance made their <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z001" data-origname="del">column</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z014" data-origname="add">faces</tei-add> stern and quiet, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and the backs of the officers were very rigid.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As he looked at them, Fleming knew all of his
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>woe. He felt that he was regarding a procession of 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>chosen beings. The separation was as great to him as 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>if they had marched with weapons of flame and 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>banners of sunlight. He could never be like them. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He could have wept in his longings.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He searched about in his mind then for a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>proper malediction for the indefinite cause, that 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>thing <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z017" data-origname="del">to</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z016" data-origname="add">upon</tei-add> which men turn the words of final blame. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It was responsible for him. There lay the fault.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The haste of the column to reach the battle-ground 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>struck forlorn Fleming as being something <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z008" data-origname="del">more</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z007" data-origname="add">much finer</tei-add> than stout 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="overwrite pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z018" data-origname="del">st</tei-del>fighting. Heroes he thought, could find excuses in that 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>long, seething l<tei-del rend="overwrite pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z020" data-origname="del">i</tei-del>ane. They could retire with perfect 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>self-respect and make explanations to the stars.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He wondered what those men <tei-add place="above" rend="caret pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z012" data-origname="add">^had eaten</tei-add> that <tei-del rend="overwrite ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z013" data-origname="del">cothey</tei-del> could be so 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bitter to force their ways to chances of death. As he watched 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his envy grew until he wished to change lives with one of them. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He would have like to have used a tremendous force, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>thrown off himself and became a better. Swift picture 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of himself apart yet in himself came to him--a blue 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>desperate figure leading lurid charges with one knee 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>forward and a broken blade high -- a blue 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>determined figure standing before a crimson and steel 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>assault getting calmly killed on a high place before
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="11" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="overwrite pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z018" data-origname="del">st</tei-del>fighting. Heroes he thought, could find excuses in that 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>long, seething l<tei-del rend="overwrite pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z020" data-origname="del">i</tei-del>ane. They could retire with perfect

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>thing <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z017" data-origname="del">to</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z016" data-origname="add">upon</tei-add> which men turn the words of final blame. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It was responsible for him. There lay the fault.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The haste of the column to reach the battle-ground 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>struck forlorn Fleming as being something <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z008" data-origname="del">more</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z007" data-origname="add">much finer</tei-add> than stout 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="overwrite pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z018" data-origname="del">st</tei-del>fighting. Heroes he thought, could find excuses in that 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>long, seething l<tei-del rend="overwrite pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z020" data-origname="del">i</tei-del>ane. They could retire with perfect 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>self-respect and make explanations to the stars.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He wondered what those men <tei-add place="above" rend="caret pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z012" data-origname="add">^had eaten</tei-add> that <tei-del rend="overwrite ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z013" data-origname="del">cothey</tei-del> could be so 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bitter to force their ways to chances of death. As he watched 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his envy grew until he wished to change lives with one of them. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He would have like to have used a tremendous force, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>thrown off himself and became a better. Swift picture 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of himself apart yet in himself came to him--a blue 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>desperate figure leading lurid charges with one knee 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>forward and a broken blade high -- a blue 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>determined figure standing before a crimson and steel 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>assault getting calmly killed on a high place before
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="11" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_78" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>78<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>enemy. They felt the pride of their onward movement when 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the whole army seemed trying to dribble down this road. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>They tumbled teams about with a fine feeling that it was 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>no matter so long as their column got to the front in time. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>This importance made their <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z001" data-origname="del">column</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z014" data-origname="add">faces</tei-add> stern and quiet, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and the backs of the officers were very rigid.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As he looked at them, Fleming knew all of his
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>woe. He felt that he was regarding a procession of 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>chosen beings. The separation was as great to him as 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>if they had marched with weapons of flame and 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>banners of sunlight. He could never be like them. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He could have wept in his longings.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He searched about in his mind then for a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>proper malediction for the indefinite cause, that 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>thing <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z017" data-origname="del">to</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z016" data-origname="add">upon</tei-add> which men turn the words of final blame. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It was responsible for him. There lay the fault.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The haste of the column to reach the battle-ground 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>struck forlorn Fleming as being something <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z008" data-origname="del">more</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z007" data-origname="add">much finer</tei-add> than stout 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="overwrite pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z018" data-origname="del">st</tei-del>fighting. Heroes he thought, could find excuses in that 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>long, seething l<tei-del rend="overwrite pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z020" data-origname="del">i</tei-del>ane. They could retire with perfect 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>self-respect and make explanations to the stars.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He wondered what those men <tei-add place="above" rend="caret pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z012" data-origname="add">^had eaten</tei-add> that <tei-del rend="overwrite ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z013" data-origname="del">cothey</tei-del> could be so 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bitter to force their ways to chances of death. As he watched 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his envy grew until he wished to change lives with one of them. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He would have like to have used a tremendous force, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>thrown off himself and became a better. Swift picture 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of himself apart yet in himself came to him--a blue 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>desperate figure leading lurid charges with one knee 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>forward and a broken blade high -- a blue 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>determined figure standing before a crimson and steel 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>assault getting calmly killed on a high place before
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="11" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>woe. He felt that he was regarding a procession of

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It was responsible for him. There lay the fault.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>The haste of the column to reach the battle-ground 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>struck forlorn Fleming as being something <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z008" data-origname="del">more</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z007" data-origname="add">much finer</tei-add> than stout 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="overwrite pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z018" data-origname="del">st</tei-del>fighting. Heroes he thought, could find excuses in that 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>long, seething l<tei-del rend="overwrite pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z020" data-origname="del">i</tei-del>ane. They could retire with perfect 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>self-respect and make explanations to the stars.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He wondered what those men <tei-add place="above" rend="caret pencil" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z012" data-origname="add">^had eaten</tei-add> that <tei-del rend="overwrite ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_78_z013" data-origname="del">cothey</tei-del> could be so 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bitter to force their ways to chances of death. As he watched 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his envy grew until he wished to change lives with one of them. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He would have like to have used a tremendous force, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>thrown off himself and became a better. Swift picture 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of himself apart yet in himself came to him--a blue

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>determined figure standing before a crimson and steel

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_79" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_79_z031" data-origname="metamark">79</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>everybody. He thought of the magnificent pathos of his dead body.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He was up-lifted. He felt the quiver of <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z018" data-origname="del">a rapid,</tei-del> 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>war-desire. <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z019" data-origname="del">He</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z020" data-origname="add">In his ears, he</tei-add> heard the ring of victory and knew the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>frenzy of a rapid, successful charge. The music of the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>trampling feet, the sharp voices, and the clanking 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>arms of the column made him soar on the red wings 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of war. For <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z020" data-origname="del">a</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z021" data-origname="add">a few</tei-add> moment<tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z022" data-origname="add">s</tei-add>, he was sublime.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He thought that he was about to start fleetly 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>for the front. Then the difficulties of the thing began 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>to drag at him. He hesitated, balancing awkwardly 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>on one foot.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He had no rifle; he could not fight with 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his hands. Well, rifles could be had for the picking.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Also, it would be miraculous if he found his 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>regiment. Well, he could fight with any regiment.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He started forward slowly. He stepped as if he 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>expected to tread upon <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z023" data-origname="del">some</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z024" data-origname="add">an</tei-add> explosive thing. Doubts 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and he were struggling.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He would truly be a worm if any of them should 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>see him returning thus, the marks of his flight upon 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>him. He replied that the intent fighters did not care 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>for what happened rear-w<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_79_z025" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z025" data-origname="del">o</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z025" data-origname="add">a</tei-add></tei-subst>rd saving that no hostile 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bayonets appeared there. In the battle-blur, his face 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z026" data-origname="add">be</tei-add> as hidden as the face of a cowled man.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But, then, he said that his tireless fate would, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>when the strife<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z027" data-origname="del">d</tei-del> lulled for an instant, bring 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>forth a man to ask of him an explantion. And 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he saw the scrutinizing eyes of his comrades as he 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-add place="margin-left" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z028" data-origname="add">would</tei-add> painfully labor<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z029" data-origname="del">ed</tei-del> through some lies.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="11" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>expected to tread upon <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z023" data-origname="del">some</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z024" data-origname="add">an</tei-add> explosive thing. Doubts 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and he were struggling.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He would truly be a worm if any of them should 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>see him returning thus, the marks of his flight upon 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>him. He replied that the intent fighters did not care 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>for what happened rear-w<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_79_z025" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z025" data-origname="del">o</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z025" data-origname="add">a</tei-add></tei-subst>rd saving that no hostile 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bayonets appeared there. In the battle-blur, his face 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z026" data-origname="add">be</tei-add> as hidden as the face of a cowled man.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But, then, he said that his tireless fate would, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>when the strife<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z027" data-origname="del">d</tei-del> lulled for an instant, bring 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>forth a man to ask of him an explantion. And 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he saw the scrutinizing eyes of his comrades as he 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-add place="margin-left" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z028" data-origname="add">would</tei-add> painfully labor<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z029" data-origname="del">ed</tei-del> through some lies.

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_79" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_79_z031" data-origname="metamark">79</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>everybody. He thought of the magnificent pathos of his dead body.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He was up-lifted. He felt the quiver of <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z018" data-origname="del">a rapid,</tei-del> 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>war-desire. <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z019" data-origname="del">He</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z020" data-origname="add">In his ears, he</tei-add> heard the ring of victory and knew the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>frenzy of a rapid, successful charge. The music of the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>trampling feet, the sharp voices, and the clanking 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>arms of the column made him soar on the red wings 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of war. For <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z020" data-origname="del">a</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z021" data-origname="add">a few</tei-add> moment<tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z022" data-origname="add">s</tei-add>, he was sublime.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He thought that he was about to start fleetly 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>for the front. Then the difficulties of the thing began 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>to drag at him. He hesitated, balancing awkwardly 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>on one foot.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He had no rifle; he could not fight with 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his hands. Well, rifles could be had for the picking.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Also, it would be miraculous if he found his 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>regiment. Well, he could fight with any regiment.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He started forward slowly. He stepped as if he 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>expected to tread upon <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z023" data-origname="del">some</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z024" data-origname="add">an</tei-add> explosive thing. Doubts 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and he were struggling.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He would truly be a worm if any of them should 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>see him returning thus, the marks of his flight upon 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>him. He replied that the intent fighters did not care 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>for what happened rear-w<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_79_z025" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z025" data-origname="del">o</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z025" data-origname="add">a</tei-add></tei-subst>rd saving that no hostile 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bayonets appeared there. In the battle-blur, his face 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z026" data-origname="add">be</tei-add> as hidden as the face of a cowled man.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But, then, he said that his tireless fate would, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>when the strife<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z027" data-origname="del">d</tei-del> lulled for an instant, bring 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>forth a man to ask of him an explantion. And 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he saw the scrutinizing eyes of his comrades as he 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-add place="margin-left" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z028" data-origname="add">would</tei-add> painfully labor<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z029" data-origname="del">ed</tei-del> through some lies.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="11" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his hands. Well, rifles could be had for the picking.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Also, it would be miraculous if he found his 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>regiment. Well, he could fight with any regiment.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He started forward slowly. He stepped as if he

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and he were struggling.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He would truly be a worm if any of them should 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>see him returning thus, the marks of his flight upon 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>him. He replied that the intent fighters did not care 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>for what happened rear-w<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_79_z025" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z025" data-origname="del">o</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z025" data-origname="add">a</tei-add></tei-subst>rd saving that no hostile 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bayonets appeared there. In the battle-blur, his face 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z026" data-origname="add">be</tei-add> as hidden as the face of a cowled man.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But, then, he said that his tireless fate would, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>when the strife<tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z027" data-origname="del">d</tei-del> lulled for an instant, bring 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>forth a man to ask of him an explantion. And 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he saw the scrutinizing eyes of his comrades as he

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_79" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_79_z031" data-origname="metamark">79</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>everybody.   <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>war-desire. <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z019" data-origname="del">He</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z020" data-origname="add">In his ears, he</tei-add> heard the ring of victory and knew the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>frenzy of a rapid, successful charge. The music of the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>trampling feet, the sharp voices, and the clanking 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>arms of the column made him soar on the red wings 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of war.   <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>for the front. Then the difficulties of the thing began 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>to drag at him. He hesitated, balancing awkwardly 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>on one foot.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He had no rifle; he could not fight with 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his hands. Well, rifles could be had for the picking.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Also, it would be miraculous if he found his 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>regiment. Well, he could fight with any regiment.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He started forward slowly. He stepped as if he

Doubts 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and he were struggling.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He would truly be a worm if any of them should 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>see him returning thus, the marks of his flight upon 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>him. He replied that the intent fighters did not care 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>for what happened rear-w<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_79_z025" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z025" data-origname="del">o</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z025" data-origname="add">a</tei-add></tei-subst>rd saving that no hostile 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>bayonets appeared there. In the battle-blur, his face 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z026" data-origname="add">be</tei-add> as hidden as the face of a cowled man.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But, then, he said that his tireless fate would,

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>forth a man to ask of him an explantion. And 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he saw the scrutinizing eyes of his comrades as he 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-add place="margin-left" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z028" data-origname="add">would</tei-add> painfully labor<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z029" data-origname="del">ed</tei-del> through some lies.

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He thought that he was about to start fleetly 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>for the front. Then the difficulties of the thing began 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>to drag at him. He hesitated, balancing awkwardly 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>on one foot.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He had no rifle; he could not fight with 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his hands. Well, rifles could be had for the picking.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Also, it would be miraculous if he found his 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>regiment. Well, he could fight with any regiment.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He started forward slowly. He stepped as if he

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He would truly be a worm if any of them should 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>see him returning thus, the marks of his flight upon 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>him. He replied that the intent fighters did not care 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>for what happened rear-w<tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_79_z025" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z025" data-origname="del">o</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_79_z025" data-origname="add">a</tei-add></tei-subst>rd saving that no hostile

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But, then, he said that his tireless fate would,

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>forth a man to ask of him an explantion. And 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he saw the scrutinizing eyes of his comrades as he
