<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_80" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>80<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Eventually, his courage expended itself upon his ob-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>jections. The debates drained him of the fire.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Furthermore, various ailments had begun to cry 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>out. In their presence, he could not persist in <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_80_z004" data-origname="del">re-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>maining</tei-del> flying high with red wings of war. He 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tumbled head-long.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He discovered that he had a scorching thirst. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>His face was so dry and grimey that he thought he 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>could feel his skin crackle. <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_80_z003" data-origname="del">His feet we</tei-del> Each bone 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_80_z010" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_80_z010" data-origname="del">in of</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_80_z010" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add></tei-subst> his body had an ache in it and seemingly threat-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ened to break. His feet were like two sores. His body, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>too, was calling for food. It was more powerful than 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a direct hunger. There was a dull, weight-like feeling 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in his stomach and when he moved, his head sway-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ed and he tottered. He could not see with distinctness. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Small patches of crimson mist floated before his vision.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>While he had been tossed by many emotions, he 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had not been aware of ailments. Now they beset him and 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>made clamor. As he was at last compelled to pay 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>attention to them, his capacity for self-hate was 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>multiplied. He groaned from his heart and staggered 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>off through the fields. He was not like those others, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del data-origname="del"> rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_80-0005" >A desire for news kept him in the vicinity of</tei-del> 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del data-origname="del"> rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_80-0006" >the battle-ground</tei-del> he said, in despair. He now conceded 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>it to be impossible that he should ever grow to be
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>one of them. Those pictures of glory were piteous things.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>A desire for news kept him in the vicinity of 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the battle-ground. He wished to know who was winning.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He told himself that in all his troubles he had never 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>lost his greed for a victory, yet, he said in a half apolog<tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_80_z008" data-origname="del">y</tei-del>-
  <tei-add place="margin-left" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_80_z007" data-origname="add"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ogetic ^</tei-add>manner, he could not but know that a defeat this
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="11" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>a direct hunger. There was a dull, weight-like feeling 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in his stomach and when he moved, his head sway-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ed and he tottered. He could not see with distinctness. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Small patches of crimson mist floated before his vision.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>While he had been tossed by many emotions, he

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>attention to them, his capacity for self-hate was

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>off through the fields. He was not like those others,

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>A desire for news kept him in the vicinity of 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the battle-ground. He wished to know who was winning.

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>lost his greed for a victory, yet, he said in a half apolog<tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_80_z008" data-origname="del">y</tei-del>-

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>maining</tei-del> flying high with red wings of war. He

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_80_z010" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_80_z010" data-origname="del">in of</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_80_z010" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add></tei-subst> his body had an ache in it and seemingly threat-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ened to break. His feet were like two sores. His body,

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_81" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_81_z018" data-origname="metamark">81</tei-metamark><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>time might mean many things to him. The blows of 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the enemy would splinter regiments into fragments. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Many men of courage, he thought, would be compelled to 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>desert the colors and scurry like chickens. He would ap-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pear as one of them. They would all be sullen brothers 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in distress and he could then easily believe that he had 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>not run any further or faster than others.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He said, as if in excuse, that, previously, the army 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_81_z004" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z004" data-origname="del">sh</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStX" facs="#rboc-d_81_z004" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add></tei-subst>encountered great defeats and in a few months had 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>shaken off all blood and tradition of <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z014" data-origname="del">it</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z013" data-origname="add">them</tei-add> emerging as bright 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and valiant as a new one<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z016" data-origname="del">.</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z017" data-origname="add">;</tei-add> thrusting out of sight the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>very traditions of disaster and appearing with <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z008" data-origname="add">the</tei-add> valor 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and confidence of unconquered legions. The shrilling 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>voices of the people at home <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z015" data-origname="add">would</tei-add> pipe<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z009" data-origname="del">d</tei-del> dismally for a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>time but various generals <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z010" data-origname="del">were</tei-del>would be compelled 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>to listen <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z011" data-origname="del">to</tei-del>to the ditties.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>In a defeat there would be a roundabout 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>moral vindication of himself. He thought that it 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would prove, in a way, that he had fled early be-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cause of his superior powers of perception. This he re-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>garded as a very important thing. Without salve, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he could not, he said, wear the sore badge of his 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>dishonor through life. With his heart continually as-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>suring him that he was despicable, he could not 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>exist without making it apparent to all men, im-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>parting the information through his actions.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But if the army had gone gloriously on, he 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would be indeed lost. If the din meant that now 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his army's flags were tilted forward he was a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>condemned wretch. He would be compelled be doom him-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>self to isolation. If the men were advancing, their indif-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ferent feet were trampling upon his chances <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z012" data-origname="del">of</tei-del> for a successful 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>life.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="11" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_81" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_81_z018" data-origname="metamark">81</tei-metamark><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>time might mean many things to him. The blows of 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the enemy would splinter regiments into fragments. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Many men of courage, he thought, would be compelled to 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>desert the colors and scurry like chickens. He would ap-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pear as one of them. They would all be sullen brothers 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in distress and he could then easily believe that he had 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>not run any further or faster than others.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He said, as if in excuse, that, previously, the army 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_81_z004" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z004" data-origname="del">sh</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStX" facs="#rboc-d_81_z004" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add></tei-subst>encountered great defeats and in a few months had 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>shaken off all blood and tradition of <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z014" data-origname="del">it</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z013" data-origname="add">them</tei-add> emerging as bright 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and valiant as a new one<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z016" data-origname="del">.</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z017" data-origname="add">;</tei-add> thrusting out of sight the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>very traditions of disaster and appearing with <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z008" data-origname="add">the</tei-add> valor 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and confidence of unconquered legions. The shrilling 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>voices of the people at home <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z015" data-origname="add">would</tei-add> pipe<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z009" data-origname="del">d</tei-del> dismally for a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>time but various generals <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z010" data-origname="del">were</tei-del>would be compelled 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>to listen <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z011" data-origname="del">to</tei-del>to the ditties.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>In a defeat there would be a roundabout 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>moral vindication of himself. He thought that it 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would prove, in a way, that he had fled early be-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cause of his superior powers of perception. This he re-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>garded as a very important thing. Without salve, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he could not, he said, wear the sore badge of his 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>dishonor through life. With his heart continually as-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>suring him that he was despicable, he could not 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>exist without making it apparent to all men, im-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>parting the information through his actions.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But if the army had gone gloriously on, he 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would be indeed lost. If the din meant that now 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his army's flags were tilted forward he was a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>condemned wretch. He would be compelled be doom him-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>self to isolation. If the men were advancing, their indif-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ferent feet were trampling upon his chances <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z012" data-origname="del">of</tei-del> for a successful 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>life.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="11" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_81" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_81_z018" data-origname="metamark">81</tei-metamark><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>time might mean many things to him.   <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ferent feet were trampling upon his chances <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z012" data-origname="del">of</tei-del> for a successful 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>life.

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>parting the information through his actions.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But if the army had gone gloriously on, he 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would be indeed lost. If the din meant that now 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his army's flags were tilted forward he was a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>condemned wretch. He would be compelled be doom him-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>self to isolation. If the men were advancing, their indif-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ferent feet were trampling upon his chances <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z012" data-origname="del">of</tei-del> for a successful 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>life.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="11" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_81" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_81_z018" data-origname="metamark">81</tei-metamark><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>time might mean many things to him. The blows of 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the enemy would splinter regiments into fragments. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Many men of courage, he thought, would be compelled to 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>desert the colors and scurry like chickens. He would ap-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pear as one of them. They would all be sullen brothers 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in distress and he could then easily believe that he had 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>not run any further or faster than others.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He said, as if in excuse, that, previously, the army 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_81_z004" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z004" data-origname="del">sh</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStX" facs="#rboc-d_81_z004" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add></tei-subst>encountered great defeats and in a few months had 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>shaken off all blood and tradition of <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z014" data-origname="del">it</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z013" data-origname="add">them</tei-add> emerging as bright 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and valiant as a new one<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z016" data-origname="del">.</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z017" data-origname="add">;</tei-add> thrusting out of sight the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>very traditions of disaster and appearing with <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z008" data-origname="add">the</tei-add> valor 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and confidence of unconquered legions. The shrilling 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>voices of the people at home <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z015" data-origname="add">would</tei-add> pipe<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z009" data-origname="del">d</tei-del> dismally for a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>time but various generals <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z010" data-origname="del">were</tei-del>would be compelled 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>to listen <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z011" data-origname="del">to</tei-del>to the ditties.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>In a defeat there would be a roundabout 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>moral vindication of himself. He thought that it 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would prove, in a way, that he had fled early be-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cause of his superior powers of perception. This he re-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>garded as a very important thing. Without salve, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he could not, he said, wear the sore badge of his 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>dishonor through life. With his heart continually as-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>suring him that he was despicable, he could not 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>exist without making it apparent to all men, im-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>parting the information through his actions.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But if the army had gone gloriously on, he 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would be indeed lost. If the din meant that now 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his army's flags were tilted forward he was a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>condemned wretch. He would be compelled be doom him-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>self to isolation. If the men were advancing, their indif-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ferent feet were trampling upon his chances <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z012" data-origname="del">of</tei-del> for a successful 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>life.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="11" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>to listen <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z011" data-origname="del">to</tei-del>to the ditties.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>In a defeat there would be a roundabout 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>moral vindication of himself. He thought that it 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would prove, in a way, that he had fled early be-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cause of his superior powers of perception. This he re-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>garded as a very important thing. Without salve, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he could not, he said, wear the sore badge of his 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>dishonor through life. With his heart continually as-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>suring him that he was despicable, he could not 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>exist without making it apparent to all men, im-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>parting the information through his actions.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But if the army had gone gloriously on, he 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would be indeed lost. If the din meant that now 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his army's flags were tilted forward he was a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>condemned wretch. He would be compelled be doom him-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>self to isolation. If the men were advancing, their indif-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ferent feet were trampling upon his chances <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z012" data-origname="del">of</tei-del> for a successful 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>life.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="11" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_81" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-metamark place="inline" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dStA" facs="#rboc-d_81_z018" data-origname="metamark">81</tei-metamark><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>time might mean many things to him. The blows of 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the enemy would splinter regiments into fragments. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Many men of courage, he thought, would be compelled to 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>desert the colors and scurry like chickens. He would ap-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>pear as one of them. They would all be sullen brothers 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>in distress and he could then easily believe that he had 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>not run any further or faster than others.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He said, as if in excuse, that, previously, the army 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_81_z004" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z004" data-origname="del">sh</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStX" facs="#rboc-d_81_z004" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add></tei-subst>encountered great defeats and in a few months had 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>shaken off all blood and tradition of <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z014" data-origname="del">it</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z013" data-origname="add">them</tei-add> emerging as bright 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and valiant as a new one<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z016" data-origname="del">.</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z017" data-origname="add">;</tei-add> thrusting out of sight the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>very traditions of disaster and appearing with <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z008" data-origname="add">the</tei-add> valor 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and confidence of unconquered legions. The shrilling 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>voices of the people at home <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z015" data-origname="add">would</tei-add> pipe<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z009" data-origname="del">d</tei-del> dismally for a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>time but various generals <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z010" data-origname="del">were</tei-del>would be compelled 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>to listen <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z011" data-origname="del">to</tei-del>to the ditties.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>In a defeat there would be a roundabout 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>moral vindication of himself. He thought that it 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would prove, in a way, that he had fled early be-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cause of his superior powers of perception. This he re-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>garded as a very important thing. Without salve, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he could not, he said, wear the sore badge of his 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>dishonor through life. With his heart continually as-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>suring him that he was despicable, he could not 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>exist without making it apparent to all men, im-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>parting the information through his actions.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But if the army had gone gloriously on, he 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would be indeed lost. If the din meant that now 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his army's flags were tilted forward he was a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>condemned wretch. He would be compelled be doom him-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>self to isolation. If the men were advancing, their indif-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ferent feet were trampling upon his chances <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z012" data-origname="del">of</tei-del> for a successful 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>life.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="11" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He said, as if in excuse, that, previously, the army 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_81_z004" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z004" data-origname="del">sh</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dStX" facs="#rboc-d_81_z004" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add></tei-subst>encountered great defeats and in a few months had 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>shaken off all blood and tradition of <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z014" data-origname="del">it</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z013" data-origname="add">them</tei-add> emerging as bright 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and valiant as a new one<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z016" data-origname="del">.</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z017" data-origname="add">;</tei-add> thrusting out of sight the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>very traditions of disaster and appearing with <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z008" data-origname="add">the</tei-add> valor 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and confidence of unconquered legions. The shrilling 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>voices of the people at home <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z015" data-origname="add">would</tei-add> pipe<tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z009" data-origname="del">d</tei-del> dismally for a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>time but various generals <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z010" data-origname="del">were</tei-del>would be compelled 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>to listen <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z011" data-origname="del">to</tei-del>to the ditties.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>In a defeat there would be a roundabout 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>moral vindication of himself. He thought that it 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would prove, in a way, that he had fled early be-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cause of his superior powers of perception. This he re-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>garded as a very important thing. Without salve, 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>he could not, he said, wear the sore badge of his 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>dishonor through life. With his heart continually as-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>suring him that he was despicable, he could not 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>exist without making it apparent to all men, im-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>parting the information through his actions.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But if the army had gone gloriously on, he 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would be indeed lost. If the din meant that now 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>his army's flags were tilted forward he was a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>condemned wretch. He would be compelled be doom him-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>self to isolation. If the men were advancing, their indif-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ferent feet were trampling upon his chances <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dStB" facs="#rboc-d_81_z012" data-origname="del">of</tei-del> for a successful 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>life.
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="11" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_82" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>82<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As these thoughts went rapidly through his mind, he sud-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>denly turned upon them and tried to savagely thrust 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>them away. With woe upon his face, he denounced him-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>self as a villian. He was he said the most unutterably 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>selfish man in existence. His mind pictured the men who 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>would place their defiant bodies before the spear of the 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>yelling battle-fiend and as he saw their wetltering corpses 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>on an imagined field, he said that he was their murderer.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Again, <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_82_z013" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z013" data-origname="del">H</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z013" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add></tei-subst>he thought that he wished he was dead. He believed 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that he envied the corpses. Too, he achieved a species 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of contempt for some of them as if they <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z003" data-origname="del">had done a</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z001" data-origname="del">an</tei-del> <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z002" data-origname="del">a wrong action</tei-del>were guilty for thus becoming lifeless<tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z014" data-origname="add">.</tei-add> 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>They might have been killed by lucky chances, he 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>said, before they had had opportunities to flee or 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>before they had been really tested. Yet they would 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>recieve laurels from traditions. He cried out bitterly 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that their crowns were stolen and their robes of 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>glorious memories were shams. <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z004" data-origname="del">Yet</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z005" data-origname="add">However</tei-add>, he thought it 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>was a pity that he was not as they.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>A defeat of the army had suggested itself to him 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>as a means of escape from the consequences of his 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>fall. He considered howerer that it was <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z009" data-origname="del">very</tei-del>use-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>less to think of such a possibility. His education 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had been that success for that mighty, blue <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z010" data-origname="del">and</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z011" data-origname="del">steel</tei-del>machine was certain; that it would make 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>victories as a contrivance turns out buttons. He pres-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ently discarded all his speculations in the other dir-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ection. He returned to the true creed of soldiers.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As he percieved again that it was not possible for 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the army to be defeated, he began to bethink him of a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>fine tale which he could take back to his regiment
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="12" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>said, before they had had opportunities to flee or 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>before they had been really tested. Yet they would 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>recieve laurels from traditions. He cried out bitterly 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that their crowns were stolen and their robes of

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>was a pity that he was not as they.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>A defeat of the army had suggested itself to him 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>as a means of escape from the consequences of his

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>less to think of such a possibility. His education 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had been that success for that mighty, blue <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z010" data-origname="del">and</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z011" data-origname="del">steel</tei-del>machine was certain; that it would make 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>victories as a contrivance turns out buttons. He pres-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ently discarded all his speculations in the other dir-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ection. He returned to the true creed of soldiers.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As he percieved again that it was not possible for 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the army to be defeated, he began to bethink him of a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>fine tale which he could take back to his regiment
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="12" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_82" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab data-origname="ab"><tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>82<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of contempt for some of them as if they <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z003" data-origname="del">had done a</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z001" data-origname="del">an</tei-del> <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z002" data-origname="del">a wrong action</tei-del>were guilty for thus becoming lifeless<tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z014" data-origname="add">.</tei-add>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>recieve laurels from traditions. He cried out bitterly 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that their crowns were stolen and their robes of

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>fall. He considered howerer that it was <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z009" data-origname="del">very</tei-del>use-

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had been that success for that mighty, blue <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z010" data-origname="del">and</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z011" data-origname="del">steel</tei-del>machine was certain; that it would make

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>of contempt for some of them as if they <tei-del rend="multistrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z003" data-origname="del">had done a</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z001" data-origname="del">an</tei-del> <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z002" data-origname="del">a wrong action</tei-del>were guilty for thus becoming lifeless<tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z014" data-origname="add">.</tei-add> 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>They might have been killed by lucky chances, he 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>said, before they had had opportunities to flee or 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>before they had been really tested. Yet they would 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>recieve laurels from traditions. He cried out bitterly 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that their crowns were stolen and their robes of 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>glorious memories were shams. <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z004" data-origname="del">Yet</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z005" data-origname="add">However</tei-add>, he thought it 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>was a pity that he was not as they.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>A defeat of the army had suggested itself to him 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>as a means of escape from the consequences of his 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>fall. He considered howerer that it was <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z009" data-origname="del">very</tei-del>use-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>less to think of such a possibility. His education 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had been that success for that mighty, blue <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z010" data-origname="del">and</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z011" data-origname="del">steel</tei-del>machine was certain; that it would make 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>victories as a contrivance turns out buttons. He pres-

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ection. He returned to the true creed of soldiers.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As he percieved again that it was not possible for 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the army to be defeated, he began to bethink him of a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>fine tale which he could take back to his regiment

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z001" data-origname="del">an</tei-del> <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z002" data-origname="del">a wrong action</tei-del>were guilty for thus becoming lifeless<tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z014" data-origname="add">.</tei-add> 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>They might have been killed by lucky chances, he 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>said, before they had had opportunities to flee or 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>before they had been really tested. Yet they would 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>recieve laurels from traditions. He cried out bitterly 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>that their crowns were stolen and their robes of 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>glorious memories were shams. <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z004" data-origname="del">Yet</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z005" data-origname="add">However</tei-add>, he thought it 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>was a pity that he was not as they.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>A defeat of the army had suggested itself to him 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>as a means of escape from the consequences of his 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>fall. He considered howerer that it was <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z009" data-origname="del">very</tei-del>use-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>less to think of such a possibility. His education 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had been that success for that mighty, blue <tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z010" data-origname="del">and</tei-del>
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="doublestrikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_82_z011" data-origname="del">steel</tei-del>machine was certain; that it would make 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>victories as a contrivance turns out buttons. He pres-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ently discarded all his speculations in the other dir-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>ection. He returned to the true creed of soldiers.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>As he percieved again that it was not possible for 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the army to be defeated, he began to bethink him of a 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>fine tale which he could take back to his regiment
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="12" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_84" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z003" data-origname="metamark">84</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"> XII.<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It was always clear to Fleming that he was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>entirely different from other men, that he <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z005" data-origname="add">had</tei-add> been
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cast in a unique mold. Also, he regarded his
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>sufferings as peculiar and unprecedented. No man
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had ever <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z009" data-origname="del">y </tei-del> achieved such misery. There was a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>melancholy grandeur in the isolation of his exper-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>iences. He saw that he was a speck raising his
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z012" data-origname="del">tiny</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z013" data-origname="add">minute</tei-add> arms against all possible forces and fates
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z015" data-origname="del">h</tei-del>which were swelling down upon him like
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>storms. He could derive some consolation from
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>viewing <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z017" data-origname="del">his</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z019" data-origname="add">the</tei-add> sublimity of the odds.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But, as<tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z020" data-origname="add"> he</tei-add> went on, he began to feel that, after all,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z022" data-origname="del">his rebellion, nature perhaps had not concentrated
  herself against him, or, at least, that</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z023" data-origname="add"><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z031" data-origname="del">him</tei-del></tei-add>
  nature <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_84_z024" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z024" data-origname="del">would</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z024" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add></tei-subst> not blame him for his rebellion.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z025" data-origname="add">still</tei-add> distinctly felt that he was arrayed against
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the universe but he began to believe that there
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>was no malice agitating <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z026" data-origname="del">his</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z027" data-origname="add">the vast breasts of his</tei-add> space-filling foes.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z028" data-origname="del">He w</tei-del> It was merely law.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Nature had provided her creations with various
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>defenses and ways to escape that they might fight or
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>flee, and she had limited dangers in powers of at-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tack and pursuit, that the thing<tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z029" data-origname="add">s</tei-add> might resist or
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>hide with a security proportionate to their strength
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and wisdom. It was all the same old philosophy. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He could not omit a small grunt of satisfaction
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>as he saw with what brilliancy he had reasoned
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>it all out.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He now <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z030" data-origname="add">said</tei-add>, that, if, as he supposed his life was
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="12" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_84" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z003" data-origname="metamark">84</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"> XII.<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It was always clear to Fleming that he was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>entirely different from other men, that he <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z005" data-origname="add">had</tei-add> been
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cast in a unique mold. Also, he regarded his
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>sufferings as peculiar and unprecedented. No man

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>melancholy grandeur in the isolation of his exper-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>iences. He saw that he was a speck raising his
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z012" data-origname="del">tiny</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z013" data-origname="add">minute</tei-add> arms against all possible forces and fates
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z015" data-origname="del">h</tei-del>which were swelling down upon him like
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>storms. He could derive some consolation from
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>viewing <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z017" data-origname="del">his</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z019" data-origname="add">the</tei-add> sublimity of the odds.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But, as<tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z020" data-origname="add"> he</tei-add> went on, he began to feel that, after all,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z022" data-origname="del">his rebellion, nature perhaps had not concentrated
  herself against him, or, at least, that</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z023" data-origname="add"><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z031" data-origname="del">him</tei-del></tei-add>
  nature <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_84_z024" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z024" data-origname="del">would</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z024" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add></tei-subst> not blame him for his rebellion.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z025" data-origname="add">still</tei-add> distinctly felt that he was arrayed against
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the universe but he began to believe that there
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>was no malice agitating <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z026" data-origname="del">his</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z027" data-origname="add">the vast breasts of his</tei-add> space-filling foes.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z028" data-origname="del">He w</tei-del> It was merely law.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Nature had provided her creations with various
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>defenses and ways to escape that they might fight or
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>flee, and she had limited dangers in powers of at-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tack and pursuit, that the thing<tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z029" data-origname="add">s</tei-add> might resist or
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>hide with a security proportionate to their strength
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and wisdom. It was all the same old philosophy. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He could not omit a small grunt of satisfaction
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>as he saw with what brilliancy he had reasoned
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>it all out.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He now <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z030" data-origname="add">said</tei-add>, that, if, as he supposed his life was
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="12" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_84" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z003" data-origname="metamark">84</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"> XII.<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It was always clear to Fleming that he was
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>entirely different from other men, that he <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z005" data-origname="add">had</tei-add> been
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cast in a unique mold. Also, he regarded his
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>sufferings as peculiar and unprecedented. No man
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had ever <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z009" data-origname="del">y </tei-del> achieved such misery. There was a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>melancholy grandeur in the isolation of his exper-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>iences. He saw that he was a speck raising his
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z012" data-origname="del">tiny</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z013" data-origname="add">minute</tei-add> arms against all possible forces and fates
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z015" data-origname="del">h</tei-del>which were swelling down upon him like
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>storms. He could derive some consolation from
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>viewing <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z017" data-origname="del">his</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z019" data-origname="add">the</tei-add> sublimity of the odds.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But, as<tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z020" data-origname="add"> he</tei-add> went on, he began to feel that, after all,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z022" data-origname="del">his rebellion, nature perhaps had not concentrated
  herself against him, or, at least, that</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z023" data-origname="add"><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z031" data-origname="del">him</tei-del></tei-add>
  nature <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_84_z024" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z024" data-origname="del">would</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z024" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add></tei-subst> not blame him for his rebellion.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z025" data-origname="add">still</tei-add> distinctly felt that he was arrayed against
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the universe but he began to believe that there
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>was no malice agitating <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z026" data-origname="del">his</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z027" data-origname="add">the vast breasts of his</tei-add> space-filling foes.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z028" data-origname="del">He w</tei-del> It was merely law.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Nature had provided her creations with various
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>defenses and ways to escape that they might fight or
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>flee, and she had limited dangers in powers of at-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tack and pursuit, that the thing<tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z029" data-origname="add">s</tei-add> might resist or
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>hide with a security proportionate to their strength
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and wisdom. It was all the same old philosophy. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He could not omit a small grunt of satisfaction
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>as he saw with what brilliancy he had reasoned
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>it all out.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He now <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z030" data-origname="add">said</tei-add>, that, if, as he supposed his life was
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="12" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>entirely different from other men, that he <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z005" data-origname="add">had</tei-add> been
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>cast in a unique mold. Also, he regarded his
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>sufferings as peculiar and unprecedented. No man
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had ever <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z009" data-origname="del">y </tei-del> achieved such misery. There was a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>melancholy grandeur in the isolation of his exper-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>iences. He saw that he was a speck raising his
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z012" data-origname="del">tiny</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z013" data-origname="add">minute</tei-add> arms against all possible forces and fates
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z015" data-origname="del">h</tei-del>which were swelling down upon him like
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>storms. He could derive some consolation from
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>viewing <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z017" data-origname="del">his</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z019" data-origname="add">the</tei-add> sublimity of the odds.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But, as<tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z020" data-origname="add"> he</tei-add> went on, he began to feel that, after all,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z022" data-origname="del">his rebellion, nature perhaps had not concentrated
  herself against him, or, at least, that</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z023" data-origname="add"><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z031" data-origname="del">him</tei-del></tei-add>
  nature <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_84_z024" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z024" data-origname="del">would</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z024" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add></tei-subst> not blame him for his rebellion.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z025" data-origname="add">still</tei-add> distinctly felt that he was arrayed against
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the universe but he began to believe that there
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>was no malice agitating <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z026" data-origname="del">his</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z027" data-origname="add">the vast breasts of his</tei-add> space-filling foes.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z028" data-origname="del">He w</tei-del> It was merely law.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Nature had provided her creations with various
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>defenses and ways to escape that they might fight or
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>flee, and she had limited dangers in powers of at-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tack and pursuit, that the thing<tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z029" data-origname="add">s</tei-add> might resist or
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>hide with a security proportionate to their strength
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and wisdom. It was all the same old philosophy. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He could not omit a small grunt of satisfaction
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>as he saw with what brilliancy he had reasoned
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>it all out.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He now <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z030" data-origname="add">said</tei-add>, that, if, as he supposed his life was
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="12" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#rboc-d_84" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb><tei-ab rend="top" data-origname="ab"><tei-metamark place="margin-top" function="foliation" rend="ink" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z003" data-origname="metamark">84</tei-metamark></tei-ab><tei-ab data-origname="ab"> XII.<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>It was always clear to Fleming that he was

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z012" data-origname="del">tiny</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z013" data-origname="add">minute</tei-add> arms against all possible forces and fates

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>viewing <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z017" data-origname="del">his</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z019" data-origname="add">the</tei-add> sublimity of the odds.

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z022" data-origname="del">his rebellion, nature perhaps had not concentrated

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>sufferings as peculiar and unprecedented. No man
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>had ever <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z009" data-origname="del">y </tei-del> achieved such misery. There was a
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>melancholy grandeur in the isolation of his exper-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>iences. He saw that he was a speck raising his
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z012" data-origname="del">tiny</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z013" data-origname="add">minute</tei-add> arms against all possible forces and fates
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z015" data-origname="del">h</tei-del>which were swelling down upon him like
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>storms. He could derive some consolation from
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>viewing <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z017" data-origname="del">his</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z019" data-origname="add">the</tei-add> sublimity of the odds.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>But, as<tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z020" data-origname="add"> he</tei-add> went on, he began to feel that, after all,
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z022" data-origname="del">his rebellion, nature perhaps had not concentrated
  herself against him, or, at least, that</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z023" data-origname="add"><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z031" data-origname="del">him</tei-del></tei-add>
  nature <tei-subst facs="#rboc-d_84_z024" data-origname="subst"><tei-del rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z024" data-origname="del">would</tei-del><tei-add place="inline" rend="ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z024" data-origname="add" data-empty=""></tei-add></tei-subst> not blame him for his rebellion.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He <tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z025" data-origname="add">still</tei-add> distinctly felt that he was arrayed against
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>the universe but he began to believe that there
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>was no malice agitating <tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z026" data-origname="del">his</tei-del><tei-add place="above" rend="caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z027" data-origname="add">the vast breasts of his</tei-add> space-filling foes.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z028" data-origname="del">He w</tei-del> It was merely law.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>Nature had provided her creations with various
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>defenses and ways to escape that they might fight or
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>flee, and she had limited dangers in powers of at-
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>tack and pursuit, that the thing<tei-add place="inline" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z029" data-origname="add">s</tei-add> might resist or
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>hide with a security proportionate to their strength
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>and wisdom. It was all the same old philosophy. 
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He could not omit a small grunt of satisfaction
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>as he saw with what brilliancy he had reasoned
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>it all out.
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>He now <tei-add place="above" rend="no-caret ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z030" data-origname="add">said</tei-add>, that, if, as he supposed his life was
</tei-ab><tei-milestone n="12" unit="chapter" data-origname="milestone" data-empty=""></tei-milestone></tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb><tei-del rend="strikethrough ink" hand="#SC" change="dstX" facs="#rboc-d_84_z015" data-origname="del">h</tei-del>which were swelling down upon him like
  <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>storms. He could derive some consolation from
